title: Dependency problems not reported in releng style mode
desc: In releng style mode the problems in the pde build states are not reported  which makes the debugging of build problem impossible.

title: generate build script by right clicking on a plugin generates invalid classpath
desc: Right click on a manifest, PDE Tools > generate build script. This will generate a bogus manifest.

title: mac branding incorrect when the laucher name is unchanged
desc: 3.1 RC2 When exporting an rcp app for Mac, if the launcher name is not changed the resulting application is invalid. This is because the files are deleted by the launcher.

title: OS names in generated files are incorrect
desc: Trying to make JNLP work on the mac, I just realized that the os constants used in JNLP files generated for features are invalid. For example, for mac, "macosx" is used instead of "Mac OS X".  The set of valid contants is available from http://lopica.sourceforge.net/ref.html#os-arch-codes.  I think the changes should be pretty minimal.

title: root property in packaging.properties does not seem to be used
desc: I am testing the use of the packager to create an RCP drop from an existing  SDK. The list of files specified in the "root" properties in  packaging.properties does not seem to be respected.  To reproduce:  1.  extract attachment (to follow) to a directory. 2.  modify the run.bat script according to the location of your eclipse  install and for the location where you extracted the attachment. 3.  double click run.bat to run. 4.  Observe the "eclipse-RCP--win32.zip" in the output directory contains all  root files instead of only the "eclipse.ini" and "eclipse.exe" specified in  packaging.properties.

title: [launcher] ICO file not used if launcher name is not changed
desc: 3.1  If I don't change the launcher name on the Branding page of the product  editor, the ICO file I select is not used.  The end product shows the eclipse  icon.  If I change the launcher name to 'Wassim', my custom ICO file is used.

title: [Doc]Build configuration help lists the wrong key for exclude.<library>
desc: From the table of contents select: PDE Guide->Getting Started->Features->Advanced topics in building features->Build configuration   Under the section "Plug-in specific properties" the third bullet reads  "source.<library> - lists the files that should not be copied by in the library by the compiler;"   It should be "exclude.<library> - ....." and the definition would make more sense as "lists the files that should not be copied in to the library by the compiler;"

title: Generate ANT build scripts for JWS/JNLP export of RCP application
desc: Currently exporting an RCP application as a Java Web Start launchable application is done manually through the "deployable features" export wizard. It should be possible to produce an ANT build file that can be used outside of Eclipse in order to automate the generation of JNLP artifacts.  Ideally this should work through the "Save as Ant script" option in the export wizard.

title: Templates and generic scripts do not have jnlp flags and signing
desc: Even though the eclipse.buildScript task supports the generation of jnlp files, its invocation in the  genericTargets.xml does not pass in the parameters for jnlp generation and jar signing. Likewise the template does not have any value for the scripts. This is a good candidate for 3.1.1

title: [workspace] build.properties exclude is not applied to javac
desc: I'm wrapping some externally maintained code in a plugin for use in eclipse. The code has a single source folder that includes subfolders that should not be compiled. I can correctly configure the project to compile using the "Excluded" feature of the java build path for normal projects. However, when I switch to PDE, I can no longe compile the project since there is no way to exclude source folders from being compiled.  Would it work to modify excluded.<library> so that it excludes those files from the compilation (not just from the .jar file)?  Or, why not allow a jar file to simple be the contents of an output folder (such as bin/) so that it could be compatible with the .classpath files, I would then make an output folder for each jar, and jar them up for use in the PDE. I would get the nice Build Path UI to boot.

title: Allow product configurations to be built by Ant scripts
desc: The 3.1 product configuration stuff looks very nice/interesting.  Unfortunatley, it does not appear to be Ant scriptable.  We would like to be able to take advantage of the support, but must be able to embed the result into an automated build.  Please consider adding Ant build script support around the product configuration stuff.

title: build with "eclipse.buildScript" fails on MacOS because of incorrect bootclasspath
desc: Running the build on MacOS doesn't work because the rootclasspath property is making incorrect assumptions on the location of the JRE. The build.xml generated by the "eclipse.buildScript" ant task contain the following:  	<path id="path_bootclasspath"> 		<fileset dir="${java.home}/lib"> 			<include name="*.jar"/> 		</fileset> 	</path>  but on MacOS it should be: 	<path id="path_bootclasspath"> 		<fileset dir="${java.home}/../Classes"> 			<include name="*.jar"/> 		</fileset> 	</path>  To make it portable, the generated code should be:  	<condition property="dir_bootclasspath" value="${java.home}/../Classes"> 		<os family="mac"/> 	</condition> 	<property name="dir_bootclasspath" value="${java.home}/lib"/> 	<path id="path_bootclasspath"> 		<fileset dir="${dir_bootclasspath}"> 			<include name="*.jar"/> 		</fileset> 	</path>   There's a workaround, see http://eclipse.techforge.com/index.php/article/188

title: The message of eclipse.idReplacer is wrong.
desc: The following were displayed in the result of Ant Bild.   [eclipse.idReplacer] Could not findxxxxxx  One blank is necessary just before the embedded clause character.   BUG: IdReplaceTask.java  line=219: System.err.println("Could not found" + new String(elementId));

title: [doc] Update help to describe how to use the customBuildCallbacks
desc: We need some doc to describe how to use the mechanism that has been added as a fix for bug #35371 - more flexibility building a plugin/fragment.

title: build.proerties template in org.eclipse.pde.build has typo
desc: The build.properties located in the templates/ dir in the PDE build plugin has  the following section....  # The list of {os, ws, arch} configurations to build.  This  # value is a '&' separated list of ',' separate triples.  For example,  #     configs=win32,win32,x86 & linux,motif,x86 # By default the value is *,*,* #config=win32, win32, x86 & \ #	linux, gtk, ppc &\ # linux, gtk, x86 & \ #	linux, gtk, x86_64 & \ #	linux, motif, x86 & \ #	solaris, motif, sparc & \ #	solaris, gtk, sparc & \ #	aix, motif, ppc & \ #	hpux, motif, PA_RISC & \ #	macosx, carbon, ppc  The description for this section references the "configs" property, but the  commented out property shown below is "config".  Should be "configs".  Present in 3.1, 3.1.1 and 3.2.

title: Ant Build File Generation for 2.1 very slow
desc: There is a bug in the ClassPathComputer2_1 which leads to an exponential runtime complexity. this leaves my computer occupied for hours when calculating the classpath.   The recursive method addPrerequisites has only two termination conditions 1. we bump in a cycle 2. we have explored all pathes from here to PI_RUNTIME  To prevent this we need another parameter, which keeps a set of visited nodes. Indeed the solution in ClassPathComputer3_0 seems alright.  Kind Regards, Felix Leipold

title: unpack default is wrong
desc: Created attachment 134092 [details] test site  Build ID:  I20090429-0800  Steps To Reproduce: 1. Install com.test.F12.feature.unpack   More information: This will cause 3 plugins to be installed with the following unpack parameters    <plugin          id="com.test.F121.plugin.unpack_default"          version="1.0.0"/>    <plugin          id="com.test.F122.plugin.unpack_true"           version="1.0.0"          unpack="true"/>    <plugin          id="com.test.F123.plugin.unpack_false"          version="1.0.0"          unpack="false"/> com.test.F121.plugin.unpack_default plugin should be unpacked but it isn't.  In Platform Plug-in Developer Guide > Reference > Other reference information > Feature Manifest <!ATTLIST plugin      unpack        (true | false) "true"

title: eclipse.buildScript fails to find element for workspace projects
desc: Invocation of  <eclipse.buildScript elements="plugin@${id}" buildDirectory="${basedir}/../${id}" />  gives  Caused by: C:\Development\UMLX\org.eclipse.gmt.umlx.source\ant.xml:73: org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Unable to find element: org.eclipse.gmt.umlx. at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.tasks.BuildScriptGeneratorTask.execute(BuildScriptGeneratorTask.java:73) at org.apache.tools.ant.UnknownElement.execute(UnknownElement.java:275) at org.apache.tools.ant.Task.perform(Task.java:364) at org.apache.tools.ant.Target.execute(Target.java:341) at org.apache.tools.ant.Target.performTasks(Target.java:369) at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeSortedTargets(Project.java:1216)  Comparing BuildScriptGeneratorTask with BuildPluginAction suggests that the 3 lines that initialise the PDEState are missing. Creating my own version with the additional   generator.setPDEState(TargetPlatform.getState()); generator.setNextId(TargetPlatform.getPDEState().getNextId()); generator.setStateExtraData(TargetPlatform.getBundleClasspaths(TargetPlatform.getPDEState()));  fixes the problem.  (See org.eclipse.gmt.umlx.releng and org.eclipse.gmt.umlx.releng.lib for the fixed classes, which are invoked as described at the top of org.eclipse.gmt.umlx.source/ant.xml).

title: Headless build failure with Eclipse 3.6.1
desc: Build Identifier: M20100909-0800  I have upgraded my build environment to use the latest Eclipse 3.6.1, however now the build fails with the following error:        [java] Installing org.eclipsetrader.platform.workbench 1.0.0.v201010121058.       [java] Installation failed.       [java] An error occurred while collecting items to be installed       [java]  session context was:(profile=SDKProfile, phase=org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.engine.phases.Collect, operand=, action=).       [java]  No repository found containing: osgi.bundle,org.apache.ant,1.7.1.v20090120-1145       [java]  No repository found containing: osgi.bundle,org.eclipse.ant.core,3.2.101.v20091110_r352       [java]  No repository found containing: osgi.bundle,org.eclipse.core.variables,3.2.200.v20090521       [java]  No repository found containing: osgi.bundle,org.eclipse.equinox.concurrent,1.0.1.R35x_v20100209       [java] Application failed, log file location: /home/marco/eclipse/configuration/1286873998424.log  The product doesn't need (nor includes) any of the listed plugins so why  pde thinks that they are needed ? The log file mention on the last line doesn't exists so I don't know what happens.  PDE version is org.eclipse.pde.build_3.6.1.R36x_v20100823.  The same exact build script works well when using org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5.1.R35x_20090820.   Reproducible: Always

title: the new pde/build versioning breaks source lookup
desc: the bundle version for pde.build says "3.2.0.qualifier", while the source zip  is located in a directory called src/org.eclipse.pde.build_3.2.0.200510181009.  This breaks the long-standing contract with the pde.core.source extension  point where the source directory must be named <plugin_version>_<plugin_id>. We therefore cannot locate the source file.  If pde/build wants to go down that route, then I suggest the build process be  consistent and replaces ".qualifier" with the build id in the manifest.mf file.

title: Generating source feature zip includes binary feature directory
desc: I am trying to generate a stand-alone drop of a source feature and it's plug- ins using the generate.feature build.property setting:  ie. generate.feature@org.eclipse.pde.source=org.eclipse.pde  The problem I encounter when I do this is that the final zip contains the  org.eclipse.pde feature directory.

title: [log] cyclic dependencies not caught at build time
desc: It seems that cyclic dependencies would not be caught by pde build. This is problematic since the compilation will fail and figuring out what has happened might not be immediatly trivial.

title: Site-build seems to ignore compiler settings
desc: I have a workspace with serveral plugins (some of them need jdk1.5) and appropriate feature and site projects. the normal workspace-compile has no errors (and in the runtime workbench everything works as expected). when i build the site i get compile errors for the plugins that use 1.5 (indicating that generics are not understood) so i think it is compiled with 1.4.

title: Lookup of included feature does not use version
desc: This bug is open to keep track of the fix for bug #116681 in the 3.2 stream.

title: Need custom step capability on features
desc: We need to investigate if having custom steps for features like we've done for plug-ins could bring interesting value. The thing is that there is only so many things that can be done and very little information is available.

title: Overriding .qualifier with forceContextQualifier does not work as expected
desc: Hi,  Today I started to use PDE build to get my plugins built without firing up eclipse.  But here's my problem: If I use the standard qualifier substitution (datetime) everything works fine but when I override the qualifier with something like  forceContextQualifier  =beta2  for example, the plugin jars get renamed correctly to pluginid-1.0.0.beta12.jar but the Manifest inside is not touched at all.  It is, as said before, being touched when not overriding the qualifier because the date stamp appears after my plugin version and the whole Manifest has been rewritten (Bundle-Version at the end, CR/LF on Linux)  If you need more material please feel free to ask me.

title: null in the excludes list while copying resources
desc: In the build.xml generated by PDE build for the resources.win32 fragment, I can find: <!-- Copy necessary resources --> <copy todir="${temp.folder}/@dot.bin" failonerror="true" overwrite="false"> <fileset dir="src/" excludes="**/*.java, **/package.htm*,null"/> </copy>  Note the "null" at the end of the excludes list.

title: [doc] Ensure that all the build.properties options are documented
desc: In 3.2 a lot of new options have been added in the build.properties. We need to make sure they are documented.

title: [doc] document the name and format of the file containing the final versions of a plugin
desc: Files named finalPluginsVersions.<config>.properties and finalFeaturesVersions.<config>.properties are generated in the working directory.  For a given bundle the plugin file contains   <bundleSymbolicName>=<version>   <bundleSymbolicName>_<3_First_segment_of_the_version>=<version>  If a bundle appears multiple time   <bundleSymbolicName>=<version> refers to the highest version number.

title: [doc] document the existence of customSteps for features.
desc: Need to document how to use customSteps for features.

title: Add pre/post steps to PDE packager
desc: The addition of pre and post steps to the PDE packager would be very handy, allowing the user the opportunity to tweak any files prior to the next step. This would follow the example set by PDE build.

title: Compilation problems when using 1.6 compatibility
desc: Cloned to PDE Build as the second file (SourceTests) is in PDE Build.  +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #388157 +++  In Fedora, we use BREE 1.6 as the lowest possible one. Two compilation errors appear in pde:  (1) eclipse.pde.ui/apitools/org.eclipse.pde.api.tools/src/org/eclipse/pde/api/tools/internal/search/SkippedComponent.java, around line 145.   			public int compare(Object o1, Object o2) { -				return ((String)o1).compareTo(o2); +				return ((String)o1).compareTo((String)o2);  The source of the problem may be  minimum bree set to 1.6.  (2) eclipse.pde.build/org.eclipse.pde.build.tests/src/org/eclipse/pde/build/internal/tests/SourceTests.java around line 131:  assertTrue(FrameworkUtil.createFilter(filter).match(properties));  I don't recall all the details but there was some hierarchy change in Properties/Dictionary structure, which means that in case of using BREE 1.6 causes problems with casting.

title: package scripts should not use hard-coded paths for baseLocation
desc: I notice the generated package.org.eclipse.sdk.win32.win32.x86.xml script uses a hard-coded path for the baseLocation, ie.  <copy file="/builds/eclipsebuilder200601251609/src/baseLocation/ plugins/com.ibm.icu_3.4.2.jar" tofile="${assemblyTempDir}/${pluginArchivePrefix} /com.ibm.icu_3.4.2.jar"/>  Could the ${baseLocation} Ant property be used here instead?  The hard-coded path will not work for those who want to use the source build downloads to rebuild the SDK with pre-built pieces.

title: malformed plugin causes its silent deletion
desc: My product had a plugin, the owners of which sought to have packaged as a single JAR. They made appropriate changes to its build.properties  > jars.compile.order = . > bin.includes = META-INF/,\ >                icons/,\ >                lib/,\ >                plugin.properties,\ >                plugin.xml,\ >                . > src.includes = eistools/,\ >                schema/,\ >                templates/ > source.. = eistools/ > output.. = bin/  but failed to remove  > Bundle-ClassPath: eistools.jar, >  lib/wpai.mediators.command.jar  from their MANIFEST.MF. As a result, during the build,  0 the plugin gets checked out (along with the rest)  1 PDEB generates the plugin's build.xml with "." in place of "@dot"  2 the plugin is subsequently deleted (presumably by the malformed   target=clean)  3 the build continues until failing with log error like   > Basedir /path/to/pde-build/plugins/name.of.plugin does not exist  The fix in this case, was to revert to a directory-based plugin by  build.properties ~= s/./nameOfPlugin.jar. (Presumably removing property=Bundle-ClassPath from MANIFEST.MF would also work.)  The plugin was in fact malformed, but PDEB's response was just as certainly wrong: the build should not delete the plugin and then fail with a misleading error message. Deleting the plugin is the worst part, since it makes debugging the problem much harder.

title: & characters in the path to ECLIPSE_HOME are not escaped in the buildfile
desc: I just tried to export a plugin from eclipse and got this error message:  /Users/bpodszun/EclipseWorkspace/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.ui/temp/org.eclipse.pde.container.feature/build.xml:29: The following error occurred while executing this line: /Users/bpodszun/EclipseWorkspace/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.ui/temp/org.eclipse.pde.container.feature/build.xml:10: The following error occurred while executing this line: /Users/bpodszun/EclipseWorkspace/WicketTest/build.xml:77: The entity name must immediately follow the '&' in the entity reference.  After checking the temporary build.xml file in that directory I discovered that my path to the eclipse binary was the problem. The cause of the error: <path id="@dot.classpath">                         <pathelement path="../../../../Applications/Text & Development/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.tomcat_4.1.130.v20051212/tomcatwrapper.jar"/>  This happens to be the first line of quite some occurences of my (uncommon) path. The & should be proper encoded by the UI, imo.

title: generate.plugin@ does not work from UI
desc: I am unable to generate a source plug-in from a feature in the UI.  -Import the projects in the zip into a workspace (in following attachment). -Generate a build.xml for the feature.   -Observe "all.plugins" does not call the build.xml in "a.plugin.source" and there is no apparent generation of this source plug-in.

title: "calculate version id" should use only number of fields supplied.
desc: Seems to me, that the handy trick of using "0.0.0" in feature.xml, as an indication that the version ID should be calculated automaticlly during build process, should be "masked" by how many zero's are supplied.   With the plugin versioning process, where we use ".qualifer" at the end of plugin version numbers (which are filled in by map tags), it makes the feature.xml files overly specific to include all 4 digits automatically. I would have expected it to include only 3 digits (or .. even only two, if only 2 zeros supplied).   To give a concrete example, in our xerces feature, we have     <plugin          id="org.apache.xerces"          download-size="0"          install-size="0"          version="0.0.0"/>  but after the build, this get's translated to      <plugin          id="org.apache.xerces"          download-size="0"          install-size="0"          version="2.7.0.v20060128_1458"/>   I'm not sure if there's any advantages or disadvantages to one or the other .. but .. sure seems confusing to me. (and, if 4 places were desired, then user could simply specify "0.0.0.0" to get all four fields calculated).

title: Generated source plugin contains no source
desc: FeatureBuilderScriptGenerator.collectSourcePlugins can fail to record plugins to be gathered for source when that plugin has not been encountered before (since bug 124304)   In AssemblyInformation.getAllCompiledPlugins(), bundleProperties.get(IS_COMPILED) will return null if we haven't generated scripts for the bundle before causing the  bundle to be ommited.   If we get a null here, we should probably look for the existence of a build.properties file.  Currently source generation only works if the feature.source appears after the feature in the include list of the SDK container feature.

title: package step for tar.gz archives includes resources from baseLocation only
desc: When building the eclipse SDK with a baseLocation that contains com.ibm.icu binary and source plug-in, these are the only resources that end up in the final eclipse SDK tar.gz files.  Example assemble and package scripts to follow as attachements.

title: specifying any element other than a feature to pde-build doesn't work
desc: The example in the customTargets.xml, allElements target suggests you can specify a feature, plugin, or fragment.  However, specifying 'plugin' will fail, since the generateScript steps does not generate any assemble scripts for plugins, however, the rest of the genericTargets will attempt to delegate to the assemble.plugin.id.all.xml, which doesn't exist; hence, build failure.

title: PDE generating destructive build.xml for plugins that specify Bundle-ClassPath=bin
desc: Scenario: 1) Create a dummy plugin 2) Right click on generated MANIFEST.MF and Create Ant File build.xml 3) Verify that the target "@dot" exists in build.xml 4) Add the following line to MANIFEST.MF    Bundle-ClassPath = bin 5) Re-generate build.xml 6) What should have been "@dot" is now "."  In fact everywhere that the directory "@dot" was referenced is now a ".", or it is normalized out of existence...  How is this destructive? Don't attempt the "clean" rule as it will delete your plugin!  i.e.) The first target in the "clean" rule should be       	<delete dir="${build.result.folder}/@dot"/>        However, what is generated when 'bin' appears in Bundle-ClassPath       is:         <delete dir="${build.result.folder}"/>  As soon as you attempt to perform a clean, your plugin directory will vanish. (And PDE-Build issues a "clean" prior to building)  While it might not make sense setting 'bin' on the Bundle-ClassPath, it should not cause the generation of the build.xml to be invalid (and dangerous)  Cheers,  John

title: Can't generate source plugin if target already contains it
desc: This worked in the I20060208-0848 build but not in I20060213-0800 or I20060214-0800.  I have a feature project that I am using to create a source feature for a plugin.  When I select feature.xml and do PDE Tools > Create Ant Build File the artifacts I expect to be created are not created.  I expected a /features directory and a /plugins directory (each with a pluginName.source directory and some artifacts underneath) to be created in the feature project and they were not created.  I would prefer not to attach the zip containing the plugin and feature projects as they are not currently part of the Eclipse public domain.  Sonia or I can provide the plugin and feature I was using to try to create these artifacts.

title: Need to add PDE build to javadoc and schema generation
desc: Since M5, PDE Build contributes an extension point and a few APIs. Could you please update the appropriate files so that it gets integrated in the doc?

title: Build script generated with "." instead of "@dot"
desc: When a source feature comes before its corresponding feature during a build, then when we get to that feature, we end up generating scripts for the contained plugins twice.  And, the second time we generate the scripts, if a plugin has a '.' on its bundle classpath but not as the first element (see for example org.eclipse.equinox.registry), then we incorrectly use '.' instead of "@dot" in the build script.  This causes a destructive clean as well as packaging that includes extra artifacts.

title: NPE generating build scripts headless for org.eclipse.platform.sdk feature
desc: When I try generating build scripts for the org.eclipse.platform.sdk feature (headless), I get the following NPE:  java.lang.NullPointerException         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.create30SourceFragment(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:1356)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generateSourceFragment(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:1085)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generateSourceFeature(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:1065)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generate(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:231)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generateIncludedFeatureBuildFile(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:284)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generate(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:229)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BuildScriptGenerator.generateFeatures(BuildScriptGenerator.java:168)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BuildScriptGenerator.generate(BuildScriptGenerator.java:80)   I had entered bug 128129 originally, but discovered a different stack trace when I checked the log on the build machine.(                                                             4959,1-8

title: FetchScriptGenerator does fill in the plugin and feature tags file
[log] Errors while exporting with signing not very clear
desc: When you export a plugin with signing, if the keystore is missing or if the jarsigner is not available (which happen if you are not running with a Java SDK), then the error obtained is not very clear.   For example: C:\workspaces\eclipse32ResErrors\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.ui\temp\org.eclipse.pde.container.feature\assemble.org.eclipse.pde.container.feature.win32.win32.x86.xml:53: The following error occurred while executing this line: C:\workspaces\eclipse32ResErrors\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.ui\temp\org.eclipse.pde.container.feature\assemble.org.eclipse.pde.container.feature.win32.win32.x86.xml:28: exec returned: 1

title: ico not found when project name is different from feature/plugin-id
desc: For the case that the plugin project name the icon file resides in differs from the plugin id, the icon is not found. The effect is that the launcher is not branded at all. This applies also to the 3.1 release. Though it is not that tragic for those who know how to work around it still should work.

title: Restrict the set of bundles considered by PDE Build
desc: Coming out of bug 128846, bug 105408.  Optionally restrict the set of bundles considered by PDE Build to only those bundles included by features in the transitive closure of features included and required by the main feature being built.

title: Generated JNLP files are incorrect
desc: The generated JNLP files do not properly refer to plug-in jars. For example 	<resources> 		<jar href="../plugins/org.apache.ant_1.6.2.jnlp"/> 		<jar href="../plugins/org.apache.lucene_1.4.3.jnlp"/> 	</resources>

title: [doc] eclipse.buildScript: either documentation or behavior is wrong
desc: The documentation for eclipse.buildScript (http://help.eclipse.org/help30/index.jsp?topic=/org.eclipse.pde.doc.user/guide/pde_feature_generating_ant.htm) says that "eclipse.buildScript: generates a build.xml file for the given elements."  This is untrue. When run on a feature, the task instead generates a number of "assemble.<id>.xml" and "package.<id>.xml" files. Further, these files appear to be incomplete, and will not run successfully. Either the behavior should be fixed (preferrable), or the documentation should be brought in line with the actual behavior.

title: False discouraged warnings during releng build
desc: All references accessing code from any jars.extra.classpath entry is flagged with discouraged access warning during the releng build.  This is happening of course because the state is unaware of jars.extra.classpath.  PDE/Build should do what PDE/UI does at development time which is to give JARs from jars.extra.classpath et al. unconditional visibility, as to not pollute the build logs with warnings that are not relevant to API cleanliness.

title: Test failures running PDE build tests on Hudson
desc: There are two test failures when running PDE tests on Hudson (windows and linux). Note this is also the first time running PDE build tests in 4.2 builds.  1)   testBug183924	Error	Unable to find feature "org.eclipse.e4.rcp" with version in range [1.1.0.v20120131-1846-8yFTEFygGGduEKAaxP4Lpcqr,1.1.0.v20120131-1846-8yFTEFygGGduEKAaxP4Lpcqr].  C:\hb\workspace\JUnit-win2\workarea\I20120509-1900\eclipse-testing\test-eclipse\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.8.0.v20120428-0109\scripts\genericTargets.xml:111: Unable to find feature "org.eclipse.e4.rcp" with version in range [1.1.0.v20120131-1846-8yFTEFygGGduEKAaxP4Lpcqr,1.1.0.v20120131-1846-8yFTEFygGGduEKAaxP4Lpcqr]. at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.tasks.BuildScriptGeneratorTask.execute(BuildScriptGeneratorTask.java:94) at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.EclipseDefaultExecutor.executeTargets(EclipseDefaultExecutor.java:32) at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.run(InternalAntRunner.java:672) at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.run(InternalAntRunner.java:537) at org.eclipse.ant.core.AntRunner.run(AntRunner.java:513) at org.eclipse.pde.build.tests.PDETestCase.runAntScript(PDETestCase.java:144) at org.eclipse.pde.build.tests.PDETestCase.runAntScript(PDETestCase.java:137) at org.eclipse.pde.build.tests.PDETestCase.generateScripts(PDETestCase.java:133) at org.eclipse.pde.build.internal.tests.ScriptGenerationTests.testBug183924(ScriptGenerationTests.java:156)  2)  testBug238001	Failure	expected:<604> but was:<0>  junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: expected:<604> but was:<0> at org.eclipse.pde.build.internal.tests.ProductTests.testBug238001(ProductTests.java:263)

title: Merge PDE Build POM changes into 3.8.2/4.2.2
desc: eclipse.pde.build (Juno_cbipoms):  46f22563ab331cf0599cbcecf5b58edb275f138f http://git.eclipse.org/c/cbi/eclipse.pde.build.git/commit/?h=Juno_cbipoms&id=46f22563ab331cf0599cbcecf5b58edb275f138f  c6322359f8415d01baa89bb827ef953480387134 http://git.eclipse.org/c/cbi/eclipse.pde.build.git/commit/?h=Juno_cbipoms&id=c6322359f8415d01baa89bb827ef953480387134

title: Exclude pde.build from packing
desc: Created attachment 221409 [details] Add the extra build time option  As per the discussion from Bug 369798 we will add jarprocessor.exclude.pack=true to the META-INF/eclipse.inf file.

title: eclipse.idReplacer can get confused by a copyright
desc: If a copyright notice containing the word "feature" is placed at the top of a feature.xml file, then the idReplacer can become confused and fail to replace the .qualifier in the feature version.  The idReplacer could be made (slightly) more robust by looking for "<feature" instead of "feature".  The eclipse.versionReplacer task likely has similar problems.

title: Add tycho.scmUrl for eclipse.pde.build.git
desc: Created attachment 222344 [details] eclipse.pde.build.patch  For Tycho to generate Eclipse-SourceReference headers a new property needs to be added to the pom ${tycho.scmUrl} for each repo.

title: Compiler reports "access warnings" for classes from jars in a plugin
desc: In WTP, we have some third party jars (e.g. from org.apache.xerces, and apache SOAP) which are  put, as jars, in an OSGI bundle. We do not "pack" these (outer) jars.  And, in the manifest.mf files, we export ALL the packages in the inner jars, but ... we still get ACCESS restriction warnings in our BATCH compiles ... I do not see these in the development workspace. Any hints?     22. WARNING in /shared/webtools/build-wtp-S/workdir/plugins/org.eclipse.wst.wsdl/src-http/org/eclipse/wst/wsdl/binding/http/internal/impl/HTTPUrlEncodedImpl.java  (at line 138)         return ELEMENT_TYPE_EDEFAULT == null ? elementType != null : !ELEMENT_TYPE_EDEFAULT.equals(elementType);                                                                       ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Access restriction: The method equals(Object) from the type QName is not accessible due to restriction on classpath entry /shared/webtools/build-wtp-S/workdir/plugins/org.apache.xerces/xml-apis.jar ----------

title: Update .product parsing to handle the win24Low bitmap
desc: Need to update ProductFile to get the path for the 24x24 bitmap for branding win32 from the .product file.  See bug 121735

title: Access rules not generated if jar name contains '/'
desc: For example, org.eclipse.pde.build builds a jar "lib/pdebuild-ant.jar". Access rules are not being generated for this jar because we end up trying to create a file called "javaCompiler.lib/pdebuild-ant.jar.args" which fails.  We should replace all '/' and '\' in the jar name with '_' when creating this file.

title: Modify genericTargets.xml to permit setting pluginPath
desc: 3.2M5 loosened the rigid flat directory structure of              <buildDirectory>                 features/                 plugins/  by permitting you to set the equivalent of a search path for features and plugins of the form:          pluginPath="dir1;dir2;dir3..."  on the call to eclipse.buildScript.  This allows more flexibility in organizing features and plugins within a large organization, especially those that do not use CVS and mapfiles for flattening the directory structure. However, PDEBuild does not provide a means of setting this value...  Bug 128846 contains a comment from Andrew Neifer that genericTargets.xml could/should be modified to permit a user to set pluginPath by specifying the following parameter when calling eclipse.buildScript          pluginPath=${pluginPath}  I have logged this enhancement request to track and drive this change.  Cheers,  John.

title: Packager gets bad baseLocation from previously run tasks
desc: If during the same ant script we run a fetch or generate task followed by the package task, the value of the BuildTimeSiteFactory's static installedBaseLocation remains unchanged as the package task does not set that variable.  This means that the site for the packaging can point to an unrelated directory, if that directory no longer exists, we get an exception with "Content Provider not set for Site".  It is also conceivable that this base location could contribute unexpected versions of plugins to the packaging.

title: Related to bug 131373, the build script should set up the log file name inside a compiler argument
desc: The build script should set up the log file name using a compilerarg nested element in the javac ant task instead of using the verbose mode. See bug 131373. The corresponding compilerarg nested element should set up its compiler name in order to prevent javac from being called with this option that it doesn't support. Doing this would remove a hack from the ant adapter. We need to synchronize our changes. Veronika, you would need to update all custom builds.

title: Export deployable plugin uses the wrong JDK level
desc: Eclipse 3.2M5 on WinXP  My default JRE is Java5. I created a plugin which overrode the JRE and compiler options.  The JRE is set to JDK 1.4.2 and the compiler options are using 1.4 compliance.  When I use Export -> Deployable plug-ins and fragments the resulting classes are compiled at 5.0. When my plug-in starts, the .log file has the following, java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: (XXXplugin/Activator) bad major version at offset=6.  My current workaround is to use the classes in the build directory to rebuild the JAR.

title: The extension of the log file should be configurable
desc: This is a followup of bug 131377. Now that the log file name can be specified inside the buid.xml and not in the ant adapter, we would like to make the extension of the log file configurable. This would allow to switch to xml logs very easily without editing the source code  inside PDE/Build. So we need a new property in order to do so.

title: Ant copy task hosing permissions and symbolic links
desc: With the switch to the packaged build mechanism, we've lost permissions and symbolic links (I noticed this in the Mac SDK drop) due to the use of the Ant copy task.  Attachment of generated assemble and package scripts to follow.

title: need to adopt ICU4J APIs
desc: To complete the plan item to deliver ICU4J support in the Eclipse (see bug 127876) code must be migrated to use the com.ibm.icu.* classes in place of the default java implementation.  This component is affected.  I will attach a patch with the changes required (only import changes at this point).  This needs to be done for M6.

title: Failure to export features with only two digits in their number
desc: If the version number of a feature is set to "0.1" the export wizard fail with a "Unable to find feature".

title: Cleanup base.dir in custom gather.bin.parts targets
desc: We need to add certain files from a project when the user includes source.  Currently, with only the target.folder, we don't have enough information to find the project's home.    It would be very helpful if we added base.dir as a parameter to pre/post.source.build or pre/post.gather.sources.    Might think about adding base.dir to additional tasks to increase the flexibility of what the user can do/has access to.

title: [CBI] Bump pom version for org.eclipse.pde.build.tests
desc: Pom for org.eclipse.pde.build.tests is out of sync with the version in MANIFEST file.  MANIFEST: Bundle-Version: 1.1.400.qualifier POM: <version>1.1.300-SNAPSHOT</version>

title: [doc] Updated documentation for the new headless build system
desc: A new headless build system has been introduced and docs are missing and/or not easily available. Would it be possible to provide some docs on the wiki for early implementors? Help system has to be updated for 3.2 release, is there a bug report to track the progress? Also, the article 'Build and Test Automation for plug-ins and features" probrably needs to be updated to indicate that it works for 3.1.x but not for 3.2.x? Maybe a new article could be written or the article could be edited to reflect the new build process?

title: Destination dir with spaces is not handled by the compilerarg with line=
desc: When we set the log file name, if the destination directory has a space in it, it is tokenized in multiple parts. The line <compilerarg line="..... " ... /> doesn't do what is expected if the destination directory name contains whitespaces. The part in the line attribute is tokenized. We need to add single quotes around the log file name.

title: Source feature generation broken with sourceTemplateFeature
desc: Starting with bug 127726, source feature build script generation has been more restrictive about the version of the source feature to use.  We changed things so that we use the version of the feature we generated, however, if the feature had a sourceTemplateFeature\feature.xml, then the version of the source feature may not match the version we generated, leading to feature not found.

title: pde/build has a new friend
desc: Due to some refactoring in PDE/UI, the org.eclipse.pde.core plug-in should be made a friend of the 'org.eclipse.pde.internal.build' package (in addition to the org.eclipse.pde.ui plug-in)  Also while you're at it, org.eclipse.pde.ui is currently a friend of many packages in pde.build.  This is too generous.  We don't need any of them except for org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.  You can remove our friend access from the rest.  Thanks, Your PDE friend.

title: PDE Tools Build Ant Script neglects JavaSource JavaTarget
desc: I have a plugin project set to use the 1.5 JVM and use 5.0 JDK compliance (set at the Workspace level, not project level).  However, if I select the PDE Tools / Build Ant Script option by right clicking on my MANIFEST.MF file, the resulting build.xml reflects version 1.3 and 1.2 respectively for the JavaSource and JavaTarget properties.  I have to remember to manually update these after rebuilding the build.xml file to set them both to 1.5.  I apologize in advance if I selected the wrong Component (didn't see PDE Tools).

title: Product file contained in a unresolved plugin results in succesfull build
desc: 3.2 M6 The product build generates the feature.xml from a given product file. If in the second generation of the feature.xml this product file is contained in a plug-in that does not resolve, the file is not found, but the build continue and enventually succeed whereas of course the build should have failed.

title: customBuildCallbacks called using subant with failonerror="false"
desc: Presently, there does not appear to be a way to have the whole build fail if one of the customBuildCallbacks fails, since the generated build.xml files calls the callback targets using "subant" with "failonerror='false'"   Is there a way to have "failonerror" set to "true"?  Note: this is separate from setting javaCFailOnError to true on the command line.

title: [log] FeatureGenerator needs logging
desc: The FeatureGenerator needs to log some errors/warnings in the event of  1) product file not found 2) problems parsing the product file 3) problems writing the feature.xml

title: [log] "Create Ant build file" silently fails while "custom=true" in build properties
desc: Eclipse 3.2M5a  I used the "create Ant build file" tool to create a build file that I was the going to customize for my project, and then added a "custom=true" property to the build.properties file. I then added another source folder to the build properties and tried to regenerate the build file the same way as before. Nothing happened until I commented out "custom=true" property. I understand why you might not want to change the build.xml file in most cases when this property is true, but there should be some kind of warning, rather than a silent failure.  On a related note, while trying to figure out what was going on, I tried deleting build.xml and then regenerating it. I got an error "No custom build file found in <project directory>/build.xml. Isn't that an odd error message when I just issued the command to create such a file? Should this even be treated as an error?

title: Fetch fails for product builds
desc: Doing a build from a .product file will fail in the fetch because the FetchScriptGenerator will try and fetch the generated container feature which will not exist in the repository.   We want to be able to not fetch the container feature but still generate scripts to fetch its children.

title: Headless product build does not fetch fragments
desc: The generated container feature needs to specify fragment=true for those plugins which are fragments so that the FetchScriptGenerator can properly fetch those fragments from the repository.  Hopefully we can get this information from the .product file, see bug 136205

title: productBuild's generated feature does not handle configs
desc: When generating a container feature for a product build os, ws & arch attributes are not specified on children features/plugins/fragments that are platform specific.  This means that the *,*,* config has everything in it and other configs will be empty.  For features, we can get this information from the FeatureModel, but for plugins/fragments this information is not readily available.  There are 2 ways I see to try and guess this information: 1) deduce it from the LDAP filter BundleDescription.getPlatformFilter 2) iterate over the configs we are building and consider the set of bundles that match a given config but not the *,*,* config.

title: Performance tweak for PDEProperties
desc: Profiling the Ant ui performance tests I started seeing java.ui.File.toURL showing up as a hotspot....this is a result of the PDEProperties.  Would you consider caching of the calculated property values in PDEProperties as I do not believe these should change within an Eclipse session?

title: Need to support 1.6 EE
desc: pde.build uses the file org.eclipse.pde.build/data/env.properties to map from execution environment to javac source/target levels.  This file needs to be updated to include JavaSE-1.6

title: Do not use the class Manifest in PDEState
desc: Because of performance reason when the jars are signed, PDEState should not use the java.jar.util.Manifest class to read the manifests.

title: generated package scripts always have  archiveName values with suffix .zip
desc: This problem arose in our source builds.  In the releng build, the archive name is passed from a higher script so this is not an issue.  If you grep for the archiveName in the generated assemble scripts for linux-gtk-x86, it is correct and suffixed by .tar.gz.  If you grep for the same in the packager scripts, it is named .zip for all platforms  [kmoir@hoth src]$ grep archiveName\" assemble.org.eclipse.sdk.linux.gtk.x86.xml         <property name="archiveName" value="org.eclipse.sdk-${buildId}-linux.gtk.x86.tar.gz"/>  $ grep archiveName\" package.org.eclipse.sdk.linux.gtk.x86.xml         <property name="archiveName" value="org.eclipse.sdk-${buildId}-linux.gtk.x86.zip"/>  This causes issues with our source builds.  This is an an issue in RC1, and current N builds.  With current builds we are using pde build version 3.2.0.N20060418-0010

title: [CBI] Update PDE build parent version
desc: Created attachment 228761 [details] patch.eclipse.pde.build.R3_8_maintenance  To be applied right after I20130326-0800

title: eclipse.buildScript problems with multiple libraries
desc: Eclipse 3.2RC1a  We have a plug-in project which defines multiple libraries. In Eclipse 3.1, eclipse.buildScript would create a build.xml that defines the classpath for the second library like this:  <path id="..."/>   <pathelement path="${build.result.folder}/bin/"/>   <pathelement path="${build.result.folder}/firstLibrary.jar"/> </path>  Unfortunately, Eclipse 3.2 creates the build.xml with a classpath like:  <path id="..."/>   <pathelement path="bin/"/>   <pathelement path="firstLibrary.jar"/> </path>  This will result in problems compiling the second library if it depends on classes from the first one. Note that everything works fine if there are still class files in the bin folder.

title: [readme] can not specify relative path for builder  or buildDirectory
desc: We need to readme the fact that the properties builder  or buildDirectory can not use relative paths.

title: First call to generate feature in the product build should force verify to false
desc: In order to make sure that we do not log twice the warnings about resolution errors and also log incomplete ones, we need to set verify to false when calling the feature generator.

title: NPE from PDEProperties
desc: Someone on #eclipse-dev got this NPE while exporting plugins.  This was using the broken I20060505-0010 build, but it looks like a null check is still needed here (Bundle.getEntry() can return null, but it's not checked):  # java.lang.NullPointerException #         at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Activator.getURLConverter(Activator.java:304) #         at org.eclipse.core.runtime.FileLocator.toFileURL(FileLocator.java:125) #         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.properties.PDEProperties.getAntPropertyValue(PDEProperties.java:44) #         at org.eclipse.ant.core.Property.getValue(Property.java:112) #         at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.setGlobalProperties(InternalAntRunner.java:260) #         at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.setProperties(InternalAntRunner.java:244) #         at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.run(InternalAntRunner.java:644) #         at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.run(InternalAntRunner.java:457) #         at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) #         at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) #         at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) #         at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585) #         at org.eclipse.ant.core.AntRunner.run(AntRunner.java:356) #         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.exports.FeatureExportOperation.cleanup(FeatureExportOperation.java:553) #         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.exports.FeatureBasedExportOperation.run(FeatureBasedExportOperation.java:56) #         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.build.FeatureExportJob.run(FeatureExportJob.java:53) #         at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

title: No version range specified when requiring bundles
desc: RC3 The manifest.mf does not specify version ranges on the required bundles.

title: Error message for unresolved bundle is bogus
desc: RC4: During a build the messages reported for an unresolved fragment is bogus. For example it says: [eclipse.buildScript] Bundle org.eclipse.core.resources.linux: [eclipse.buildScript]   No host plug-in has been found for fragment org.eclipse.core.resources_[3.1.0,4.0.0). [eclipse.buildScript] Bundle org.eclipse.update.core.win32: [eclipse.buildScript]   No host plug-in has been found for fragment org.eclipse.update.core_[3.0.0,4.0.0).

title: External Zip program is called by build.xml even though the program is not available
desc: From the newsgroups:  When I try to create a new plugin with the last version of Eclipse, I have some problems to build it because the build.xml reference a external zip command that does not work on my PC. I don't understand why this version of eclipse generate a build.xml that does not support the ant's internal zip and jar task.  May be I do something wrong when I generate the plugIn project ?  Thomas Papiernik

title: [doc] build.jars task doesn't create any jars
desc: 1. Create a new plugin using the Hello World plugin. 2. generate a build file using PDE Tools actions 3. run the build file (build.jars is the default target) -> no jar files are created, just an @dot directory with class files.  The @dot target description claims that it creates a jar file, but there is no <jar> task called in it.

title: set inheritall in the generated subant call
desc: follow up on bug #142193. Because of the risk involved in changing the generated call to subAnt in the customCallbacks, we have decided not to fix the problem for rc5, but we still think it might be valuable to fix 3.2.1 if we don't ship ant 1.7.

title: generated build.xml classpath incorrect
desc: I generated the build.xml for org.eclipse.core.tools and found that it  contained the classpath (below) for use in compiling coretools.jar.  I have put  in line breaks and annotations to simplify things here.  There are several things to notice: 1) every project has a bin dir entry.  I only have about 4 source projects in  my workspace.  We should consider only adding these where required.  In any  case, the bin entries should occur with (and before) the corresponding .jar  entries if they both exist.  This better matches what happens at runtime.  2) the order of the entries is wrong.  There does not appear to be any rhyme  nor reason to the order (likely output from a hashed data structure).  the  entries should be in an order which corresponds to the order in the plugin.xml  requires statements.  Again, this matches the execution environment.  3) additional jars included in the plugin itself (e.g., tools.jar here) should  be at the beginning of the path.  ../org.eclipse.ui.views/bin; ../org.eclipse.core.runtime/bin; ../org.eclipse.core.runtime/runtime.jar; ../org.eclipse.ui.workbench/workbench.jar; ../org.eclipse.core.resources/resources.jar; ../org.eclipse.ui.win32/ui.jar; ../org.eclipse.core.boot/bin; ../org.eclipse.swt/ws/${ws}/swt.jar; ../org.eclipse.text/text.jar; ../org.eclipse.jface/bin; ../org.eclipse.ui.views/views.jar; ../org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor/bin; ../org.eclipse.ui.editors/bin; ../org.eclipse.core.resources.win32/resources.jar; ../org.eclipse.ui.workbench/bin; ../org.eclipse.jface/jface.jar; ../org.eclipse.ui.editors/editors.jar; ../org.eclipse.ui/bin; ../org.eclipse.ui/ui.jar; ../org.eclipse.swt.win32/ws/${ws}/swt.jar; ../org.eclipse.core.resources.spysupport/spysupport.jar; ../org.eclipse.core.resources/bin; ../org.eclipse.swt/bin; ../org.eclipse.text/bin; ../org.eclipse.ui.win32/workbenchwin32.jar; ../org.eclipse.jface.text/bin; ../org.eclipse.core.boot/boot.jar; ../org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor/texteditor.jar; tools.jar; ../org.eclipse.core.resources.spysupport/resources.jar; ../org.eclipse.jface.text/jfacetext.jar

title: IndexOutOfBoundException thrown when parsing erroneous archivesFormat
desc: 3.2 - When an erroneous archivesFormat is being specified an exception is thrown. Now that we know how to log, we should catch the error and report it in a nice way.

title: PDE build fails
desc: Eclipse 3.0 RC3  When I try to build an update site, the build fails with an error message.  This does not happen on RC2.  My workspace (IBM INTERNAL USE ONLY) can be downloaded from   http://w3.austin.ibm.com/dfs/home/bhunt/public_html/rc3.tgz    The update site is in the hdwb project and you will need the latest EMF to build.

title: Export of multiple plugins fails
desc: I have two plugins: plugin A exports a library lib.jar, plugin B uses this library.   If I try to export both plugins at once as deployable plugins, this plugin fails because of compiling errors in plugin B. The compiler could not find the classes from lib.jar.  If I export each plugin alone, everything works fine.   This error also occurrs when I deploy a feature that contains both plugins.

title: NPE when generating a build.xml for a plugin without library
desc: Asking the generation of a build.xml for a plugin that do not declare library  in its runtime section causes a NPE to occur.

title: Can no longer build plugins, ant fails to find swt classes
desc: I've been having trouble building my plugins with the release candidates (have yet to try anything older than RC1).  Since it could be caused by a problem in my setup, I have some steps to reproduce using the plugin new wizard.  1) Get RC3a 2) unzip/run 3) File/Import/External plugins and fragments 4) Leave extract source unchecked, click next 5) Select the org.eclipse.ui plugin and "Add Required Plug-ins" 6) finish 7) When the import is complete, do File/New/;lug-in Development/Plug-in Project 8) Project name: test, Next 9) use defaults, Next 10) Select "Hello, World", Next 11) use defaults, Next 12) use defaults, Finish 13) Click yes to switch to the plugin devel perspective 14) Navigate in the Package Explorer to the test project and open it up 15) right click on the plugin.xml and "Create Ant Build File" 16) right click on the newly generated build.xml 17) Use defaults, Run 18) Notice the Console says:  ...        [javac] 1 .class file generated        [javac] Compilation failed. Compiler errors are available in /home/burner/jdks/eclipse/eclipse/workspace/test/temp.folder/test.jar.bin.log        [javac] Compile failed; see the compiler error output for details. ... 19) Refresh the test project 20) Examine temp.folder/test.jar.bin.log 21) Notice the error:  ---------- 1. ERROR in /home/burner/jdks/eclipse/eclipse/workspace/test/src/test/actions/SampleAction.java !! no source information available !! This compilation unit indirectly references the missing type org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell (typically some required class file is referencing a type outside the classpath) ---------- 1 problem (1 error) 22) Examine the test.jar that was built in the filesystem (I use unzip -v workspace/test/test.jar) 23) Notice how it only has the testPlugin.class in it (there is no test.actions.SampleAction class)

title: Change template build.properties values
desc: The template build.properties should be changed so that the minimum amount of changes are necessary for a user to preform a headless build.  The properties skipMaps = true skipBase = true should both be set to facilitate a simple build scenario.

title: Should we keep the eclipse application whe
desc: When running a headless build using the following command  eclipse.exe -application org.eclipse.pde.build.Build  or   eclipse.exe -application org.eclipse.pde.build.Build -consoleLog  if the build fails for any reason, a popup appears explaining where to find the log file. Hence the build process hangs.

title: Find broken NLS strings in PDE Build
Create BuildManifestTask to log plug-in versions included in each build
desc: We need a new Ant task with almost the same parameters as the Fetch task in  order to generate a manifest file to document what plug-ins and versions were  included in a specific build.

title: Product build breaks on grouped configuration
desc: Product builds are breaking on grouped configurations.  Pascal has identified that the  allElements.xml in the productBuild directory is missing the following target:  <target name="assemble.org.eclipse.pde.build.container.feature.group.group.group"> - <ant antfile="${assembleScriptName}" dir="${buildDirectory}">   <property name="archiveName" value="${archiveNamePrefix}-group.group.group.zip" />    </ant>   </target>

title: build.update.jar target builds each plugin twice
desc: When the build.update.jar target is called on a feature's build.xml file, each  of the required plugins get build.jars called twice.  This causes the plugin to  compile twice.

title: zip.distribution is missing call to gather.bin.parts
desc: build F1  It seems the zip file produced by the "zip.distribution" target is empty with  this build. Serious bug. Should investigate and fix during FP1.

title: When creating the update.jar, the compile log should go to a temp folder
desc: build F1  When creating an update JAR, there should be no resources left in the plugin  dir. Currently the compile log stays around. Suggest fixing during FP1.

title: Packager property featurePaths not used correctly
desc: The packager property featurePaths is supposed to specify a list of roots where features and plugins will be located.  It is passed to the packager task as ${tempDirectory}/${featurePaths} So if the user actually had a list: "eclipse, myProduct" Then the result would be  "${tempDirectory}/eclipse, myProduct".  For this to actually work with a list the user would need to specify his list as: "eclipse, ${tempDirectory}/myProduct"

title: customBuildCallbacks doesn't support absolute paths
desc: Our PDE Build broke when we moved from 3.2 M4 to 3.2 RC4.  In our build.properties we have a property that is an absolute path, such as: myTools=D:/myTools  In many of our plugins we have customBuildCallbacks that uses this property: customBuildCallbacks=${myTools}/scripts/customStuff.xml  This worked fine in PDE Build 3.2 M4, where the generated Ant code for the customBuildCallbacks is similar to: 	<available property="customBuildCallbacks" file="${myTools}/scripts/customStuff.xml" value="${myTools}/scripts/customStuff.xml"/> [...] 	<ant antfile="${customBuildCallbacks}" target="pre.build.jars"> 		<property name="build.result.folder" value="${build.result.folder}"/> 	</ant>  This breaks in PDE Build 3.2 RC4, where the generated Ant code has changed to: 	<subant antfile="${customBuildCallbacks}" target="pre.build.jars" failonerror="false" buildpath="."> 		<property name="build.result.folder" value="${build.result.folder}"/> 	</subant>  <subant antfile=""> doesn't work with an absolute path.  The message we are getting is:    [subant] Invalid file: D:\Build\pde-build\plugins\org.my.plugin\D:\myTools\scripts\customStuff.xml  It doesn't kill the build, but it doesn't run any of the custom tasks (which is worse that killing the build).

title: Directory missing from exported plugin when its name includes spaces
desc: Build id: N20060529-0010 Create a brand new plugin project. Add to it a folder named 'With White Space' (directly at the root). Add some content into it. In the build tab, select With White Space as being part of the binary build. Export as deployable plugin and check the result: no With White Space directory there. Start over with a 'WithoutWhiteSpace' directory name: it gets exported.  That might be the intended behavior. In such case though, I'd love to get an error message.

title: Test failures due to Equinox Framework Changes
desc: 8 failures http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops4/N20130627-2000/testresults/html/org.eclipse.pde.build.tests_linux.gtk.x86_6.0.html

title: Documentation for headless build
desc: It would be very helpful if the documentation for headless building for plugins developed with eclipse is there.  The only documentation available is how eclipse is built. Its very complicated and confusing. Would be great if a simple example with a simple plugin is explained. After a lot of googling i could finally build my plugins using headless mode but I had to mannually select the plugins into a feature and then use the build process.  Also, the testing for eclipse plugins is nowhere explained for headless mode. It should be possible to do both junit tests on individual plugins as well as intergration testing on a product/feature/plugin after build.

title: no taskdefs
desc: With 3.2 ant build.xmls generated for plugins use eclipses own task, eclipse.versionReplacer, to update the version. When trying to compile such a build.xml on commandline ant can't find a definition for that "eclipse.versionReplacer" task!   A desired solution would be to either surround the usage with a  if="eclipse.running"  or to define the task ant wants this to look like, something like this: <taskdef name="eclipse.versionReplacer" classname="org.eclipse....ClassName"/>

title: No Plugins dir in buildDirectory results in error
desc: If ${buildDirectory}\plugins does not exist when we go to build a state for PDE Build, then the content provider tries to add ${buildDirectory} itself to the state, which fails since it is not a bundle the error "An error occured while generating manifest ..." will stop the build.  This is not strictly a proper setup, workaround is to create the plugins directory.  Though it is perhaps possible to have a product build whose plugins are all in the baseDirectory.

title: Update PDE build BREE to 1.6
desc: Since PDE build extends FileSet from Apache Ant, the update to Ant 1.9.x causes PDE build to no longer compile - as FileSet now has generics in it.  We could simply up the BREE now to get a test build running and fix the type warnings later for M1.

title: Packages missing from manifest
desc: The following packages are missing from the pde.build manifest: org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.fetch org.eclipse.swt.tools.internal  Do we want to export the swt.tools.internal?  Should we rename it to avoid potential conflict with packages from swt?

title: BuildScriptGenerator should not force an order to set configInfo and archivesFormat
desc: The eclipse.buildScript task is written in such a way that it requires the configInfo attribute to be set first if the archivesFormat attribute is to have any effect.  When invoking an Ant task from inside a <macrodef>, there seems to be no guarantee on the the order the task attribute setters will be invoked. In general it seems that Ant attempts to set task attributes in the order the attributes appear in the build script, but this is NOT the case when the task appears inside a macrodef.  My build script calls eclipse.buildScript from inside a macrodef, and the behavior that I am seeing is that BuildScriptGeneratorTask#setArchivesFormat is always being called before BuildScriptGeneratorTask#setConfigInfo, no matter what the order of the archivesFormat and configInfo parameters are. This means that the archivesFormat parameter is effectively useless when using eclipse.buildScript from a macrodef.  In general, it's a bad idea for these two attributes to be order dependent, since this is not documented anywhere and is not obvious unless looking at the pde build code.  I propose refactoring BuildScriptGenerator so that setArchivesFormat can be called after AbstractScriptGenerator#setConfigInfo.  This behavior appears in the 3.2RC7 and the latest org.eclipse.pde.build from CVS.

title: Let's re-design how source is associated with code.
desc: I've never quite understood how we ended up with the "feature based" method of association source plugins and code plugins, but seems like one lesson of Callisto is that it doesn't really fit the desired work flow.   There is a related bug 148407, but what I wanted to document here was more use-cases as needed by a Callisto sort of project.   I think the main work flow model should be "install everything runtime only", but select those things you want source for. The selected source would be everthing, one or two plugins, or, I suppose a whole feature, it could also be done as part of the update/install operation, for those who know in advance what they want, but in some cases, the source may not be needed until (much) later while debuggin some problem.   Also, seems if runtime is installed first, and then later, selected source is installed, it is only good download design to download exactly what is needed, and not re-download or install the runtime code.   Seems to me that 'source code" should be a fragment of a runtime plugin. Especially with the new four part verioning scheme, seems the source fragment could be clearly marked to go with some exaxt verion of the plugin, instead of relying on features to pair them up.

title: JNLP generation should only contains plugins for the config being built
desc: i create a build automation for my RCP JavaWebStart application. the generated *.jnlp-file for the org.eclipse.rcp feature contains all avaliable platform-references but only the win32 & linux reference jars are bundeled!

title: jnlp generation don't resolve binding between feature.xml & their translation files
desc: the generated jnlp files contains the %feature.name & %feature.provider from the MANIFEST.MF which links to the feature.properties file!

title: Product Export does not create a working package for gtk-linux
desc: When using 3.2.0 Build M20060629-1905, the package generated by the product export in the UI does not work for gtk linux.  This is  also true if the package is generated in a headless manner  via productBuild.xml.    It does not seem to matter what host platform is used to build  the package...building on windows or linux (FC4) creates an unusable  package.  After exporting the product, everything seems fine, however when you attempt to run the native launcher, the initial splash screen for the product appears, but then eclipse exits with a dialogue pointing to a log file.  The log file states that product-specific classes cannot be found.  There is also mention of an SWTError class that cannot be found.  This class resides in org.eclipse.swt.gtk.linux.x86_3.2.0.v3232m.jar, which is not included in the exported product.  The applcation-specific classes do exist under the plugin directory.  When exporting to win32,  the generated package works fine.

title: Feature based product build fails with Problems parsing the feature.
desc: Product build based on features rather than plugins in a PDE automated (headless) build. Fails with:  BUILD FAILED  C:\Documents and Settings\aolionaird\builder2\ProductBuilder\build.xml:49: The following error occurred while executing this line: C:\callisto\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.2.0.v20060603\scripts\product Build\productBuild.xml:21: The following error occurred while executing this line:C:\callisto\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.2.0.v20060603\scripts\productBuild\productBuild.xml:45:   Problems parsing the feature file:C:/SSP_Build/features/org.eclipse.pde.build.container.feature/feature.xml.  Please see the following posts for further info:  http://dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.platform.rcp/msg14699.html

title: .class files not included in exported plugins
desc: When exporting a plugin which project as src and bin directories, the .class files are not included in the jar generated. Adding the bin directory to the Binary Build configuration triggers the .class files to be included but with a wrong path: bin\com\whatever\whatever.class It looks like a regression in 3.2 release. Was working in 3.2RC7

title: Support for subversion repositories in PDE Build
desc: In JBossIDE, a lot of our new source code contributions have been coming from subversion repositories, and unfortunately PDE doesn't natively support this method for source retrieval. To solve the problem, I recently coded up support for it by making a custom genericTargets.xml, and creating an ant task that is very similar in function to the "eclipse.fetch" ant task.  I'm attaching 3 files: - The edited genericTargets.xml which works for both CVS & SVN (CVS is used by default unless a property is set) - The ant task implementation needed by genericTargets.xml - A sample SVN map file (which looks/feels very close to the CVS map file)  It would be really cool if you PDE build gurus could find a way to merge this stuff into the PDE build system =).

title: [JavaWebStart] a chance to remove offline-allowed property from jnlp on automated build
desc: i use the automated build system to deploy my rcp-jws application. how can i avoid the property <offline-allowed/> from the generated jnlp files?

title: BundleDescription.getExecutionEnvironments returns empty array
desc: I've not yet figured out exactly how to reproduce this, but I sometimes get BundleDescription.getExecutionEnvironments returning an empty array even though there is a Bundle-RequiredExecutionEnvironment header in the manifest.  I've noticed this most recently with the bundle org.eclipse.rse.services.ssh which is in the attachment https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=47786 on bug 148260.

title: BundleDescription.getExecutionEnvironments returns empty array
desc: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #153778 +++  This is a bug to track bug 153778 against HEAD.  The fix in 3.2.1 passes a string to createBundleDescription which gets tokenized.  In HEAD, we should instead use the new API which accepts an array.  This will move our dependency on osgi forward to 3.2.100

title: Fix compiler warnings in build
desc: Fix the compiler warnings in the builds. See for example  http://download.eclipse.org/downloads/drops/I20060822-1200/testResults.php

title: gather logs does not include nested features
desc: I'm entering this bug as a follow-on to our wtp bug 155921.   I was quite surprised to find some of our compile logs (and their occasional error) was not being "gathered up" and posted to our drop site.   I tracked down the "change in behavior" on our end to the way we listed "included features" several months ago.   To give a brief simplified description, we have a wst feature, which includes a wst.ui feature, and that wst.ui feature includes an xml.core feature.   Ideally, in the wst feature, we'd only have to list the xml.ui feature.  And, everything (else) about the build seems to work find doing it that way.   But, we've found we need to explicitly list the xml.core feature, in the high level wst feature, even though that seems redundant and should be unnecessary.   I was thinking "maybe its just us" ... but, while looking for a solution, or good example to follow, found this comment in the "master" buildConfig of the releng.eclipsebuilder (in the gatherLogs helper target):   <!--HACK:  copy logs from features which nest others because they are not included in the zip created above.-->   As far as I know, this is the only place "nesting" doesn't work ... so, sure would be nice if it did!

title: FeatureGenerator should have an option for the included launcher feature
desc: The FeatureGenerator adds an optional include for the org.eclipse.platform.launchers feature to the generated feature.  If someone was using the FeatureGenerator for something other than building a product (ie, just building plug-ins) they probably don't want this include.  We should have an option to turn this off.
