title: Export deployable plugins/features wizards fails with target plugins imported
desc: The Export deployable plug-ins and export deployable features wizards fail for me when I have imported plugins from the target platform into the workspace.  The wizards (both of them) report that building the plug-ins failed and that a log.zip file has been created. Inside the log.zip file are error logs for each plugin essentially indicating that none of the Eclipse classes could be found.  When I delete the imported plug-in projects from my workspace these wizards work without errors.  To replicate:  1. Open the New Plug-in Project wizard and use the template to create the 'Hello World' plugin. 2. Open the Export Deployable Plug-ins wizard and export this plugin. It will work fine. 3. Open the Import Plug-in and Fragments wizard and import all workbench plugins. 4. Now try the Export Deployable Plug-ins wizard again on the 'Hello World' plugin. This fails for me, creating a log.zip file.

title: Add featureList & pluginList to productBuild.xml
desc: The FeatureGenerator supports adding additional features and plugins to the generated feature.  However, productBuild.xml does not expose this functionality.

title: Should be able to provide build.properties to generated feature
desc: The feature generator should allow providing a build.properties file for the generated feature. This would allow product builds to do more interesting things like specify root files for the product, or generate source plug-ins/features.  This becomes more interesting when bug 158761 is fixed as well.

title: Ensure that we are able to support multiple versions of the same plugin in the build
desc: The issues I have in mind are: - map files only support one entry for each bundle. We would likely need some mention about the versoin. - features list plugins with saying 0.0.0. 0.0.0 would have to be changed to a version.

title: Add hook for obfuscation
desc: For building commercial products based on eclipse a hook for obfuscation in an automated build is needed. This includes also the build of update-sites. At the moment there is only a possibility to enable/disable signing of jars but ONLY for "packaged" builds - not for update-site-builds  What would be usefull is a hook which is called every time a jar was generated.

title: [doc] invalid link in the "feature and plugin build configuration"
desc: The link to Feature and Plug-in Custom Build Steps is invalid in the file org.eclipse.pde.doc.user/reference/pde_feature_generating_build.htm

title: Unbuffered I/O in pde.build
desc: There are many instances of unbuffered i/o in pde.build.  Wrapping these in BufferedInputStream/BufferedOutputStream would reduce disk access.

title: Feature qualifier suffix algorithm problems
desc: This bug covers several defects in the algorithm for computing the feature qualifier suffix.  These defects are grouped together because it is extremely likely that they will all be fixed at the same time.   (1) Certain increases in the qualifier of a plugin can result in a decrease of the qualifier suffix for the feature.  To trigger the bug, there has to be a slight increase in one digit of the plugin's qualifier and a large decrease in the subsequent digit.  For example, take a feature containing one plugin.  The following plugin version numbers result in the following qualifier suffixes: 1.2.3.aaa-0z-aaa -> ------ooo-3B-ooo 1.2.3.aaa-10-aaa -> ------ooo-32-ooo The qualifier suffix decreased ('B' -> '2') even though the plugin version increased ('0' -> '1').   (2) The qualifier suffix can decrease from one build to the next if the longest qualifier among the plugins gets shorter, even if that qualifier increases in value.  For example, take a feature containing two plugins.  The following plugin version number pairs result in the following qualifier suffixes: 4.5.6.xyz, 1.2.3.abccccc -> --------1022qqqq 4.5.6.xyz, 1.2.3.abcd    -> -----------1022r The qualifier suffix decreased ('1' -> '-') even though the plugin version increased ('c' -> 'd').   (3) The qualifier suffix will remain unchanged if some '-' characters are appended to the qualifier of a plugin, where the plugin qualifier in question is not the longest qualifier of all the plugins in the feature.  For example, take a feature containing two plugins.  The following plugin version number pairs result in the following qualifier suffixes: 1.2.3.abcdefg, 4.5.6.xyz   -> --------1022rstu 1.2.3.abcdefg, 4.5.6.xyz-- -> --------1022rstu The qualifier suffix was unchanged even though the plugin version increased (blank -> '-').

title: Product configuration launcher arguments section does not support space
desc: I was originally to file this under PDE/UI, but in fact, the underlying processing of the launcher arguments still doesn't allow anybody to use arguments in launcher configurations that have spaces. See the ticket where I originally entered a discussion on, ticket #88766:  -  Alex, the eclipse.ini file cannot possibly come out ok if your usage is the following: "My product is called 'My Application' and I want to use the -name feature of the eclipse launcher to set that"  In the product editor, since no documentation says otherwise, naively you would enter in the launcher argument multi-line text:  -name My Application  This however causes the ini to have three lines. Next step, you think "I guess I should have quoted the app name so they dont cut it up":  -name "My Application"  which, since the quotes aren't processed, just gets you:  -name "My Application"  in the ini file (which then gives a command line of  "-name" ""My" "Application"")  Finally, if you try Alex's last example, say:  >   <launcherArgs> >      <programArgs>-name >hello there world</programArgs> >   </launcherArgs> > >where "-name" and "hello there world" were put on 2 separate lines in the >product editor.    As alex points out, that still doesn't work:  >However, when exporting, the eclipse.ini looks like: >-name >hello >there >world  instead of -name hello there world  At least, that's my understanding of Eddie's situation.   In Summary:  The *BUG* is very simple: there is NO WAY to use a space in ANY ARGUMENT in ANY LAUNCHER built via PDE.    I see the culprit: the use of StringTokenizer to process the launcher arguments, without offering any space-escape syntax.

title: support copying folders to a specified folder from the root (add a root option)
desc: It would be nice if PDE Build supported something like root.folder.<folder> in its set of options. There may be a use case where people want to copy another folder in the root of Eclipse. The example I can think of is a JRE.  Please refer to blocker bug for more details.

title: minor glitch in eclipse sdk feature suffix
desc: Do you all like to collect cases where the suffix is computed  in a non-monotonic way? Here's one for the eclipse.sdk feature.       3.2.1.r321_v20060801-tQ1w49KnTArT0FZ (3.2.1 release)     3.2.1.r321_v20060801-iy4CzlSkiFk_pNZ (11/29 version)     3.2.1.r321_v20060801-wy4D-BLij8Q1bPZ (12/5 version)  Seems all is fine now (12/5), but the 11/29 version "went down" from the released version. I suspect the feature should be changed to 3.2.2 at this point anyway ... but, thought I'd call it to your attention, since I have a faint memory of you all wanting to "see some cases".

title: Support for qualifier substitution within a string
desc: Currently users are able to specify a bundle version of 1.0.0.qualifier and have the qualifier automatically filled in at build time.  This is a request to enhance this feature and allow for string substitution for users to append a qualifier to a partial string. For instance - 1.0.0.1_qualifier.  In our specific case, we are putting third-party bundles into Orbit and we would like to maintain their current version number. We like the addition of the qualifier because it allows for updates but some libraries already have 4 parts to their version so this mechanism would allow the qualifier to be appended to the already existing 4 part version.  Yes this only allows for 9 updates before the sorting is incorrect, but it allows the original number to be preserved. Perhaps our story going forward should be that we prepend the last version with a 0 if necessary. (e.g. 1.0.0.01_qualifier for v1.0.0.1)

title: [doc] document the property customBuildCallbacks.failonerror=true
desc: Need to document property customBuildCallbacks.failonerror=true

title: Build fail with message about dependencies but no details are given
desc: While reproducing #161042, I ended-up in a state where I had unsatisfied dependencies but where no details about those dependencies where given. I have created a zip containing everything needed to recreate the problem, however because it is 25M I'm not attaching it here.

title: Need to call a jar unsigner when exporting for jnlp
desc: JWS does not like having multiple signers for the same application. Therefore we need to remove the signature from the eclipse jars when we are exporting. I will attach the code to strip signature.

title: Support for HTTP in map files
desc: We should add support to map files so we can add a line and it will get the bundle from an HTTP request. This will be used (for instance) in the case of Orbit bundles where they might already be in bundle form and just need to be added to the build.  Can we use the new IFetchFactory API to do this? Something like writing code that gets the URL from the map file and opening a connection on the URL to download the bytes? Or perhaps we should be calling the "Get" Ant task to retrieve the JAR?

title: Ant scripts: eclipse.fetch  with fetchTag parameter is not initialized if no value is given
desc: Build ID: 200610251409  Steps To Reproduce: 1.in org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.FetchScriptGenerator the variable protected Properties fetchTags is only initialized if a value is given 2. 3.   More information: In the Help topic “Generating Ant scripts from the command line”, the entry for eclipse.fetch has the following for the fetchTag parameter: - fetchTag : optional, overrides the tag provided in directory file by the given value;  However, in org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.FetchScriptGenerator, the variable protected Properties fetchTags is only initialized if a value is given.

title: Update feature.xml for executable
desc: We need to update the feature.xml for org.eclipse.equinox.executable to include the launcher project and all its fragments.

title: Update feature/plug-in list for headless product builds
desc: In the feature generator for headless product builds there is code which adds the platform.launchers project to the feature that we are generating. This code needs to evolve to handle the case in 3.3 where we have the executable feature and the launcher plug-in/fragments.

title: Need a way to specify user defined platform properties
desc: see bug 137743 for details on user defined platform property support in the framework.  Developers are now able to add any property they like to their platform filter.  Not just the limited set that we used to support (osgi.os, osgi.arch, osgi.nl, osgi.arch etc.).  For example, a bundle could add the following platform filter to only resolve on the IBM vm.  Eclipse-PlatformFilter: (java.vm.vendor=IBM Corporation)  PDE-build needs a way to allow developers to specify their own platform properties for the target platform.  This would be similar to how PDE-Build currently sets the platform-properties for osgi.arch, osgi.os etc.  Maybe these extra platform properties would be specified in a properties file?

title: Add new arg to CVS fetch factory
desc: In order to add support to PDE/Build we should add a new argument to the CVS map file entry that allows us to check out a pre-built bundle from CVS.  Currently the CVS map file entry is a bunch of comma-separated arguments and this would require adding a new one. I propose we modify the format to be help specify new args easier. Something like:   type@id=CVS,[args] where:   args - comma-separated list of key/value pairs  I will attach a patch with the proposed change, as well as the support for the new argument.

title: [doc] update the doc to describe support for multiple versions in the map file
desc: We need to update the doc describing the support for multiple versions in the map files.

title: fetch scripts not generated properly with pde build from I20070206-0010
desc: I ran a test build with the pde build from the I20070206-0010 build and it seems that the fetch scripts are not generated properly and the build fails.  I'll attach the partially completed fetch script for the sdk.examples.

title: [doc] Update doc to include GET fetch syntax
desc: We need to document the syntax of the GET fetch map file entry.

title: [doc] Update doc to include new CVS args
desc: We need to update the documentation to include the new syntax for the CVS map file entry format. We have change from the multi-comma format to using key/value pairs separated by commas.   We also need to list the common key names. (tag, cvsRoot, etc)

title: Missing APL license files
desc: Because we copied the Version class of osgi, we need to update the license files in pde build.

title: Change the version of PDE build
desc: Now that we have added quite a few new functionality, I think we should update the version number to reflect this.

title: Export RCP to MacOSX failing with 3.3 M5
desc: Eclipse 3.3 M5  I get the following error when exporting my RCP application to MacOSX (carbon/x86):  Problems during export   C:\Development\Eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\temp\org.eclipse.pde.container.feature\assemble.org.eclipse.pde.container.feature.macosx.carbon.x86.xml:114: C:\Development\Eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\temp\assemblyLocation\tmp\rssowl\macosx.carbon.x86\rssowl\RSSOwl.app\Contents\Resources\Splash.app\Contents\MacOS not found.   C:\Development\Eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\temp\assemblyLocation\tmp\rssowl\macosx.carbon.x86\rssowl\RSSOwl.app\Contents\Resources\Splash.app\Contents\MacOS not found.   C:\Development\Eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\temp\org.eclipse.pde.container.feature\assemble.org.eclipse.pde.container.feature.macosx.carbon.x86.xml:114: C:\Development\Eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\temp\assemblyLocation\tmp\rssowl\macosx.carbon.x86\rssowl\RSSOwl.app\Contents\Resources\Splash.app\Contents\MacOS not found.   C:\Development\Eclipse\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\temp\assemblyLocation\tmp\rssowl\macosx.carbon.x86\rssowl\RSSOwl.app\Contents\Resources\Splash.app\Contents\MacOS not found.  The target platform is set to 3.3 M5 (RCP) and I also got the delta pack installed (I am on windows exporting to Mac).  This worked with M4 as target.

title: bin.includes with only . includes the whole project content
desc: When the build.properties of a plugin is as follow (like we would like the org.eclipse.orbit.mapgenerator to be)  source.. = src/  output.. = bin/  bin.includes = .  src.includes = src/  The presence of only . in bin.includes causes the whole project content to be copied. The work around is to list a bogus file.

title: VM Args not getting copied from .product to ini file in Mac build
desc: Build ID: M20060921-0945  Steps To Reproduce: 1. Extract the attached file, mac-ini-copy-bug.tgz 2. Import the resulting project into eclipse. 3. Choose File->Export...->Eclipse product, and export as a MacOS x86 product, and possibly in one other configuration for reference. 4. Start the application on MacOS and the window title will be "Missing property", start it on any other platform (we used linux.gtk.x86), and the window title will be "Property: my_application_window_title".  More information: The attached project is based on the "Hello RCP" template project.  It simply reads a Java system property by calling 'System.getProperty("mac.ini.copy.bug.property")', and uses the resulting value to set the title of the application window.  The system property should be passed into the runtime by a line that looks something like '-Dmac.ini.copy.bug.property=...'  that should live in <launcher>.ini, in this case macinicopybug.ini.  Note that the application window title should be the same on all platforms, but it is incorrect on the Mac.  This works perfectly in the Linux build, for example, but in the MacOS build, the file located at macinicopybug.app/Contents/MacOS/macinicopybug.ini contains no trace of this argument.  In digging around in the build system, we found that BrandingIron.java (in the org.eclipse.pde.build plugin) seems to copy a standard .ini file into place, possibly overwriting the one containing custom arguments (take a look at BrandingIron.copyMacIni(...).   We first noticed this bug as part of our automated build system that uses the ant-based PDE build.  Please do not close this bug until we can verify that any fix also works in a headless PDE build.

title: PDE Export Wizard don't create correct OSGi bundles
desc: Build ID: I20061214-1445  Steps To Reproduce: 1. Create new plugin project using the wizard (the plugin must have at least one class). I have selected it to be standard OSGi bundle, but I think it is valid for the remaining choices. 2. Export the plugin using the Right Click -> Export -> Deployable plugins and features 3. Check the generated plugin, its MANIFEST.MF entry is not the first entry in the zip file. This violates the OSGi spec and creates problems when installing bundles from InputStream.    More information: This behaviour may not cause troubles on Equinox implementation (the implementation can simply download the whole file, open it as RandomAccessFile and everything will be correct. However, when the Jar file is opened as stream and the framework tries to get the manifest, it will fail. This is not a problem on Equinox, because it first saves the whole file in its storage and then reads the manifest. However, not all OSGi implementations will have such behaviour and can rely on this part of the OSGi spec.

title: Need some more verbosity in the PDE headless build
desc: I ran into a really hard-to-debug problem while using the PDE build. For some reason my cvs client was having issues downloading anything when launched as part of the fetch task (the error finally was "get_cvs_port_number called for invalid connection method" which seems to be *really* rare).   Anyway, I started debugging the build and saw that as part of the fetch task there's a retrieve.xml created to get the feature.xml and its build.properties. The problem is this retrieve.xml is temporary and it contains two cvs tasks and two move tasks. This died quietly because of my cvs problem and moved on to parsing the feature.xml which wasn't there which then threw an exception telling me to check my maps files (which had no problems). I'd suggest turning on failonerror=true on all of the tasks inside of the retrieve.xml so that it'll throw an Exception to the AntRunner and it'll stop there. More helpful would be also setting a logger on the AntRunner and getting turning off quiet on the cvs tasks in retrieve.xml.

title: UnzipperGenerator directs tar contents to wrong directory
desc: UnzipperGenerator, used among others by package.xml, directs the contents of tar archive to a wrong directory.  "UnzipperGenerator".  Evidence: If a file is handled as a zip file, it is unzipped twice, once with  <exec executable="unzip" dir="${tempDirectory}/.">  and again, with slightly different parameters, using <exec executable="unzip" dir="${tempDirectory}/aix.motif.ppc/.">  For tars, there is are corresponding lines  <exec executable="tar" dir="${tempDirectory}/.">  and  <exec executable="tar" dir="${tempDirectory}/."> where the second call has once again slightly different parameters.  Thus, the root files for the application do not end up in the config specific folder as they should, but instead are extracted to the platform-independent 'eclipse' folder only.  The relevant methods in the source code are UnzipperGenerator.generateUntarRootFiles(String[]) and UnzipperGenerator.generateUnzipRootFiles(String[]).

title: Contents of features with custom=true not packaged
desc: When a feature has a custom build.xml (custom = true), its contained plugins/features are not packaged in the build result.  This affects the headless product build because our container feature just includes the org.eclipse.equinox.executable feature and not the launcher bundle and fragments (which are included in that feature).  This does not seem to be an issue for UI product export since they include the launcher bundle and fragments directly in their container feature

title: [doc] Document the unzipOrder property of packager
desc: The packager can told about the order in which zips can be unzipped. This can be done with    unzipOrder=<prefixToZipFileToUnzipFirst>, <prefixToZipFileToUnzipSecond>, ...

title: Product Build fails without delta pack
desc: Running a product build will fail without the delta pack, because when the delta pack is not present, we add the launcher bundle and all its fragments to the generated feature.  However, not all the fragments are present so we fail.  We should only be adding fragments that correspond to configurations that we are actually building.

title: Feature qualifiers lose the last digit of the cvs tag
desc: Seen with basebuilder M5_33, on build.eclipse.org.  My features are tagged with v20070223 or v20070224, respectively. The feature qualifiers generated from that are like   .v2007022-7E-...   .v2007022-7J-...  I can understand that the qualifier length is limited, but sacrificing the last digit of the cvs tag seems inappropriate since it is very confusing. When I get something from the Update Manager, I frequently check that the cvs tag is the right one.

title: When building a feature, PDE build does not replace "0.0.0" version of first plugin
desc: Let's imagine a feature whose version ends with ".qualifier":  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <feature       id="myFeature"       label="MyFeature Feature"       version="1.0.0.qualifier">    <plugin          id="myPlugin"          download-size="0"          install-size="0"          version="0.0.0"          unpack="false"/>  </feature>  I'm building this feature using the automated build via PDE. Doing this I'm setting the qualifier to "1". The bug is: the version of "myPlugin" will remain "0.0.0" instead of being replaced with the actual value.  Explanation: in method org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.tasks.IdReplaceTask#execute(): you calculate the position of the end of the "feature" tag, then you replace the  ".qualifier" by the wanted value (here "1"). The problem is: after having done the replacement, the "endFeature" variable points too far in the string, so the subsequent search for the "<plugin" tag fails. A possible fix would be to update "endFeature" after having done the replacement. Note that a similar bug could also occur when replacing the "0.0.0" version by the actual plugin version: the replacements change the string, so the indexes must be updated.

title: NPE when wrong type is specified in extra classpath entries
desc: If on the extra.<jarName> entry a platform URL refers to a plugin instead of a fragment an NPE is thrown.  For example: extra.compilertooltests.jar=platform:/fragment/org.eclipse.jdt.compiler.tool

title: IBuildPropertiesConstants.PROPERTY_GENERATE_VERSION_SUFFIX not used
desc: From a quick lookup, it seems that the property IBuildPropertiesConstants.PROPERTY_GENERATE_VERSION_SUFFIX is not being used. It could be good to get rid of it.

title: Create Integration Tests for PDE
desc: I have created a small set of integration tests for the PDE/build that will verify the output of XML, properties and Zip files for plugin, feature, and product builds.  I have documented Known Issues in the class documentation of the integration tests.  There are assumptions about the environment, e.g. the RCP delta pack is installed into the base eclipse installation, that you are building a windows launcher.  These assumptions can be refined and eventually removed with more work but this is a good starting point.

title: Computation of feature qualifier should consider the full version number
desc: When in a feature a plug-in version increases but the qualifier decreases, the generated feature qualifier will decrease causing some problems. Example: initially the plugin is versionned 3.2.0.v2006 in the next iteration it is versionned 3.2.1.r321  We should consider the version number in the computation of the feature qualifier.

title: Missing white space when reporting a missing plugin
desc: When the id replacer reports a missing plugin, a white space is missing between the message and the plugin name. For example "Could not findmyPlugin"

title: target property not set
desc: I tried the PDE build from last night's build in a test build.  This is the error.  I tried the build a couple of times, with the same error.  The scripts seem to be getting generated - I don't know what the problem is.  The only thing I changed is the version of pde build.  Build N20070320-0919 (Timestamp: 200703200919):  The following error occurred while executing this line: /builds/N200703200919/org.eclipse.releng.eclipsebuilder/buildAll.xml:302: The following error occurred while executing this line: /builds/N200703200919/org.eclipse.releng.eclipsebuilder/buildAll.xml:368: The following error occurred while executing this line: /builds/N200703200919/org.eclipse.releng.basebuilder/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build/scripts/package.xml:82: The following error occurred while executing this line: /builds/N200703200919/org.eclipse.releng.basebuilder/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build/scripts/package.xml:44: Unable to find feature: org.eclipse.sdk.  The sdk feature exists on the filesystem and the build.xml is generated.  If someone could look at this with me that would be great - I'm trying to get a new  version of pde build for M6 to avoid the issue with truncated tags in the qualifier and also extra long qualifier names.

title: Unable to find the plug-in being built
desc: Consider the following version conflict:  I have a workbench with plug-ins p and q   p is version 2   q depends on p[2,3)   q also depends on r which is part of the eclipse installation however, r also depends on p[1,2) as contained in the eclipse installation. (i.e., we have two versions of p, a binary plug-in and a source project).  When trying to export q the following message is displayed in a dialog:   Problems during export   Reason:    Unable to find plug-in q_0.0.0. Please check the error log for more details.  Unfortunately, at that point there are no error logs neither in the target directory nor in the current workspace. This is especially confusing, since q_1.0.0 was being built and it was  definitely there. So were its (direct) dependencies.  When debugging the PDE I found as the real cause that r could not be resolved because its requirement p[1,2) was not met - actually p_1 was also present but could still not be found, I guess due to some shadowing by p_2. (may a plug-in depend on two different versions of the same required plug-in -- along different dependency paths?).  It would be nice if the error would be reported in a more informative way ;-)

title: Can't use RequiredExecutionEnvironment if osgi not in target
desc: pde.build gets java profiles out of the org.eclipse.osgi bundle that is in the state being built.  If the target state does not contain the osgi bundle, then we don't find any profiles, and any bundles specifying a Bundle-RequiredExecutionEnvironment will fail to resolve.  We should look in the state that is running pde.build if we don't find osgi in the target.

title: Bundles added to state multiple times when baseLocation, buildDirectory, pluginPath, or transformedRepoLocation are the same
desc: If the baseLocation points to the same location as the buildDirectory, then it seems that bundles get added to the state twice, resulting in warning messages like "Another singleton version selected: com.foo_1.0.0_v100"  We should avoid adding the bundles the second time.

title: [doc] generate.plugin requires feature
desc: Source plugin generation using generate.plugin does not work without a feature.  There does not seem to be a way to generate a single source plugin without having a feature.  Did this ever work at all?

title: IllegalArgumentException when exporting plug-ins
desc: Build ID: I20070321-0010  Steps To Reproduce: 1. Select a plug-in (e.g. org.eclipse.jface.text) 2. From the context menu, select export 3. Choose "As deployable plug-ins" 4. Click Finish on the wizard 5. The exception below is shown on the console, no export   More information: Console log  !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2007-03-21 15:42:06.572 !MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Export Plug-ins". !STACK 0 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: invalid format         at org.osgi.framework.Version.<init>(Version.java:150)         at org.osgi.framework.Version.parseVersion(Version.java:209)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.site.PDEState.getResolvedBundle(PDEState.java:436)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.computeElements(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:134)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generateChildrenScripts(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:860)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generate(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:260)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BuildScriptGenerator.generateFeatures(BuildScriptGenerator.java:178)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BuildScriptGenerator.generate(BuildScriptGenerator.java:90)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.exports.FeatureExportOperation.doExport(FeatureExportOperation.java:216)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.exports.FeatureBasedExportOperation.run(FeatureBasedExportOperation.java:45)         at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.build.FeatureExportJob.run(FeatureExportJob.java:55)         at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

title: Assembly of config includes features that have root files twice
desc: Build ID: 3.2.2  Steps To Reproduce: 1. Create a product build 2. Create a feature with root files 3. Run the exporter for the product build 4. Look at the assemble.org.eclipse.pde.build.container.feature.win32.win32.x86.xml file and notice that the feature with the root files has been included twice. e.g.  		<ant antfile="build.xml" dir="features\test.pde.root_files\" target="gather.bin.parts"> 			<property name="feature.base" value="${eclipse.base}"/> 		</ant> 		<ant antfile="build.xml" dir="features\test.pde.root_files\" target="gather.bin.parts"> 			<property name="feature.base" value="${eclipse.base}"/> 		</ant>  This patch will only run rootFileProvider features if they are not already included in the build.  Integration tests are also provided (once Integration tests get sorted out)  More information:

title: Replace requirement for multiple assemble targets in allElements
desc: It would be great if the requirement for all the assemble targets in customTargets.xml/allElements.xml could be replaced with a macro, for example:  <macrodef name="assemble">    <attribute name="featureId"/>    <attribute name="configSpec"/>  	<sequential>			  		<ant antfile="assemble.@{featureId}.@{configSpec}.xml"     dir="${buildDirectory}"/>  	</sequential> </macrodef>  The generated assemble*all.xml script could then call the macro this way:  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <project name="Assemble All Config of org.eclipse.platform" default="main"> 	<import file="${customTargets}" /> 	<target name="main"> 		<antcall target="win32.win32.x86" /> 	</target> 	 	<target name="win32.win32.x86"> 		<assemble featureId="org.eclipse.platform" configSpec="win32.win32.x86"/> 	</target>  <target name="linux.gtk.x86"> 		<assemble featureId="org.eclipse.platform" configSpec="linux.gtk.x86"/> 	</target> </project>  Each call to the macro would need to be nested in it's own target to avoid Ant property value inheritance between calls to the macros.  Separating the featureId and config spec into their own attributes will allow the macro implementor to test on these values to set the archive name.

title: Source generation broken when source feature /plugin comes first
desc: When generating a source feature we are failing to gather source for plugins that haven't been encountered yet.  This means something like the following: SDK :    include rcp.source    include rcp  will be missing source for all the rcp plugins.  I believe a problem has always existed in this scenario, bug 114150 had the affect of allowing those plugins to be gathered.  With 114150 fixed, this problem is revealed.  Work around is to make sure rcp appears before rcp.source in the SDK feature

title: Chkpii error in build N20070330-0010
desc: eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build_3.3.0.N20070330-0010/pdebuild_jar/org/eclipse/pde/internal/build/   messages.properties  JAVA2-PRB   918   Found 1 single quote in text handled by Java MessageFormat class. Double this quote.  Line: 31

title: Remove empty org.eclipse.pde.build.product.feature project
BuildApplication (org.eclipse.pde.build) in Eclipse 3.3M6 expects AntRunner to be IPlatformRunnable
desc: (Please excuse my posting this bug report with its Component set to "Ant" but I don't seem to be able to find a Component for PDE Build. I realize the problem is likely in PDE Build but since Ant is involved, please re-assign it with the correct Component for me. Thank you in advance for your understanding and help.)  Build ID: I20070323-1616  Steps To Reproduce: I'm building an RCP application from the command line so I'm invoking PDE Build using a command of the form '<launcher-name> -application org.eclipse.pde.build.Build' from inside my "builder" project.  More information: org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BuildApplication casts the instance obtained from the extension org.eclipse.ant.core.antRunner (which is currently mapped to the class org.eclipse.ant.core.AntRunner) to IPlatformRunnable but the class in question has been converted to IApplication and no longer supports IPlatformRunnable so a ClassCastException is thrown.

title: Make sure that the config.ini generated on product export does not start fragments
desc: We need to make sure that fragments listed in the config.ini are not being started because it will create errors in the log. See also bug 181628

title: Problems when exporting projects with same last segment
desc: Build ID: M20070212-1330  Steps To Reproduce: 1. Extract the attached 'ExportTestPlugin.zip' file to an arbitrary directory outside the eclipse workspace directory. 2. Import the ExportTest plugin (ExportTest/trunk directory) via Import -> Existing Projects into Workspace (do not copy the projects to the workspace!). 3. Import the ExportTestView plugin (ExportView/trunk directory) via Import -> Existing Projects into Workspace (do not copy the projects to the workspace!). 4. Open the Overview tab of the product description and configuration dialog of the ExportTest product (ExportTest.product). 5. Launch the product. -> The product should run without any errors. 6. Export the product via the 'Eclipse Product export wizard' to a directory (Destination = Directory) outside the workspace ('Synchronize before exporting' is checked). The export should terminate without any errors. 7. Try to run the exported product by executing the exe-file. This should fail, a log file should be created. 8. Inspect the two jars ExportTest_1.0.0.jar and ExportTestView_1.0.0.jar. Both ExportTest_1.0.0.jar and ExportTestView_1.0.0.jar contains the classes of the ExportTestView plugin.  More information: The product export wizard offered on the overview page of the product description and configuration dialog of a .product-file generates faulty plugin jars under some circumstances: For each plugin an appropriate jar file is created but all the jars contain the packages and classes of one single plugin. The steps described above demonstrate this issue.      In detail: The plugins 'ExportTest' and 'ExportTestView' are located outside the workspace.  Both are imported via 'Import -> Existing Projects into Workspace' with unchecked 'Copy projects to workspace' option.   Executing the product (ExportTest -> ExportTest.product -> Overview -> Testing -> Launch the product) within the eclipse ide succeeds. No problems occur.   But the product export fails:  I exported the product to a directory via the Eclipse Product export wizard offered on the overview  page of the product description and configuration dialog (i. e. editor) of the ExportTest/ExportTest.product file.   The export process terminates without any errors, but starting the product  via the generated exe-file fails. The log reports that the activator of the bundle to execute is invalid and  cannot be found respectively. A ClassNotFoundException is thrown.   Inspecting the 'plugins' subdirectory created during the export process shows  that indeed for every plugin the product consists of, an appropriate jar archive was created  but with wrong content:  Instead of containing all the classes and packages that make up the related plugins  all the jar archives consist of classes and packages of one single plugin (In this case of plugin ExportTestView).  Only the manifest.mf files, the plugin.xml files, the referenced libraries and other files marked for export in the build.properties files are exported correctly to the corresponding archives.   That's why the required activator cannot be found: It isn't exported to the jar file so far.   Exporting each plugin separately via Export... -> Plug-in Development -> Deployable plug-ins and fragments  with checked "Package plug-ins as individual JAR archives" option leads to the expected result.  But if more than one plugin are exported this way at the same time  (i. e. both plugins are checked within the Export deployable plug-ins and fragments wizard page)  the problem occurs again.   If step 2 and step 3 are swaped then everything (export and execution) works fine.    The same holds if the projects are imported via 'Import -> Existing Projects into Workspace' a second time (into newly created workspace) but this time with checked option 'Copy projects into workspace'.

title: chkpii error in N20070418-0010
desc: eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build_3.3.0.N20070418-0010/pdebuild_jar/org/eclipse/pde/internal/build/   messages.properties  JAVA2-PRB   918   Found 1 single quote in text handled by Java MessageFormat class. Double this quote.  Line: 53

title: Performance with many features and large state
desc: For large builds with a large state (>1000 plugins) and many features, on each feature when we generate scripts for the included plugins we do a call to PDEState.getSortedBundles.  This gets all resolved bundles and sorts them according to dependencies.  If there is say 500 features, then we are sorting the very large state 500 times.  This takes a long time.  solutions: 1) cache the sorted list, need to keep track if the state gets dirty to account for generated source bundles. 2) only get and sort the bundles we are actually interested in (ie the plugins in the immediate feature).  (1) is probably easier and better

title: Optionally generate fetchtask declaration for eclipse.versionReplacer
desc: We need to generate fetchtask declaration for eclipse.versionReplacer only if it will be used in the gather.bin.parts.

title: Use jarprocessor in PDE Build
desc: PDE Build should use the jarprocessor

title: Verify the content of template/packaging.properties
desc: make sure the root files properties have the right values for 3.3

title: failOnError in CVS fetch task breaks fetch
desc: The changes for bug 174194 in CVSFetchTaskFactory break the fetch when trying to get the fragment.xml for some fragments. From Kim after running a test build:  command="export -r HEAD org.eclipse.swt.gtk.linux.S390/fragment.xml" cvsRoot=":pserver:anonymous@dev.eclipse.org:/cvsroot/eclipse" dest="${buildDirectory}/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.gtk.linux.S390" quiet="true" failonerror="true"         />  old pde build  <cvs command="export -r HEAD org.eclipse.swt.gtk.linux.S390/fragment.xml" cvsRoot=":pserver:anonymous@dev.eclipse.org:/cvsroot/eclipse" dest="${buildDirectory}/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.gtk.linux.S390" quiet="true"/>  The causes a problem in the build because most of the fragments don't include fragment.xml.

title: customBuildCallbacks.buildpath is not taken into account in the available
desc: When customBuildCallbacks.buildpath is specified, the generated available task at the top of the script does not take it into account, therefore causing the customCallback to not be found.

title: baseLocation should also support configuration with platform.xml
desc: Supporting just features/plugins and links directory is not flexible enought. with Eclipse 3.x uses platform.xml to control what plugin to be loaded.  baseLocation should also support configuration with platform.xml.

title: The absence of log files result in error
desc: build i0424-0930  - start eclipse - create plug-in project - File -> Export Deployable (export as JAR..not sure if that matters) - you get a dialog saying that there were errors and the logs.zip file has been created. - logs.zip is created but empty - plug-in looks like it was exported OK.

title: Generated source fragments should have a platform-filter
desc: When the source fragments are generated, the generated manifest should have an associated platform filter.

title: PDE Build depends on org.eclipse.update* plugins
desc: Removing them after Juno (bug 311590) will break PDE Build.

title: invalid feature.xml generated for source features
desc: If the original xyz/feature.xml of a feature contains pointed brackets that are encoded as < and > and a "generate.feature:xyz.source = xyz" property is used to automatically generate a source feature during headless build, the brackets are written to the output file xyz.source/feature.xml as < and >. This breaks the entire build process with a message "Problems parsing the feature xyz.source".

title: Request for support to package flat source tree
desc: It would be great if there were support to package a flat source tree (ie. what is fetched from CVS prior to build script generation) per feature.  Zips of such artifacts would allow others to import projects from the zip directly or to use as input for command-line source builds.

title: Packager should be resilient to the presence of build.properties in features
desc: When packaging a feature that accidentally contains a build.properties, the packager will generate a build.xml for the feature and do other crazy stuffs which it is not supposed to do, since it is just to supposed to package.

title: Packager should make normalization of names an option
desc: Packager does two things: - gather plugins and features from a root feature - normalize the name and format of plugins and features  Those two behaviors should be separated so that the packager can run without normalizing.

title: Problems compiling against minimum execution environments
desc: build 3.3 m7  If we have a bundle which requires a Foundation 1.0 Execution Environment and also uses XML APIs (available from the JRE as of 1.4), technically the bundle manifest should contain the Foundation 1.0 EE and the correct XML imports. Then when we are building, as long as the XML APIs are provided by another bundle, everything should work fine.  But for now we have been requiring people to put both 1.4 and Foundation 1.0 on their list of EEs (with 1.4 first) so 1.4 is picked up as being the first EE and we use those class libraries to compile against.  We recently came across a similar problem with the Equinox Incubator JMX bundles and their javax.management related imports.  Tom and I have been looking at this problem and it looks like it is related to the EE that is being passed into the resolver in the platform properties. PDE/Build is passing a platform properties which has the EE set to 1.6...the highest version of class libraries that we use to compile.   In the State when we are figuring out what packages the system bundle provides, we take the union of the ones exported from the OSGi bundle and those provided by the class libraries. So when it comes time to resolve the bundles requiring XML, (in the case where we don't have 1.4 set as the EE) we think that we are going to get the XML APIs from the OSGi bundle and that isn't true and fails when it comes time to compile.  The fix seems to be that in PDE/Build we need to pass in multiple platform properties, one for each EE that is available so we can match against more than just one EE.  I will attach a partial patch which Tom provided which sets up a platform properties and then clones it, once for each EE. Its definatly a step in the right direction, thanks Tom!

title: build.xml needs to define a property with the version and the bundle
desc: It would be useful if the build.xml could contain property for the version and the bundle.

title: Plug-in Export fails with project in UNC path
desc: Build: I20070508  1) Create a simple plugin project whose location is a UNC path (//server/path/...). 2) Export > Deployable Plugins and Fragments.  -> The export fails. When I look at the build.xml file, it looks like the UNC path was not properly handled. It has tried to convert the UNC path to a relative path on a different drive:  <target name="all.plugins" depends="init"> 	<ant antfile="build.xml" dir="../../../../../../../OTT2F/Acct/ACCOUNTS/johnart/public/testproj" target="${target}"> 		<property name="arch" value="x86"/> 		<property name="os" value="win32"/> 		<property name="ws" value="win32"/> 	</ant> </target>

title: Ability to specify versions in generate@ line does not work
desc: Generated source feature can list a set of plug-ins that they need to contain. Now that we have the ability to have multiple versions of the same plug-in in a feature we need to be able to express in those lists the version of the plug-in that needs to be used (note that this info is used to fetch).

title: Wrong classpath created in build.xml
desc: build i0516-0010  - check out PDE/Build from HEAD - right-click on the manifest and generate a build.xml  Look at the ant task jar target's classpath. It contains only pde/build and Ant and is missing everything else.

title: generate@ handing in feature build script generator does not support the versions being specified
desc: This is a follow-up of bug #187159 fixed for 3.3 RC1. The code handling generate@ in feature build script generator does not support case where a version is specified.

title: parsing of generate@ is incorrect
desc: The parsing code of generate@ is incorrect because we forgot to specify a ";" as the delimitor in the StringTokenizer....

title: FeatureGenerator should maintain feature order
desc: FeatureGenerator uses a HashSet to collect the features to be included in the generated feature.  However, because order of the features matters for compilation, it should instead use a collection that maintains the ordering.  (Perhaps LinkedHashSet)

title: Resolver should not be set in dev mode by default
desc: The fix for bug #149609 set the resolver in dev mode. However using this mode is not always desirable, should not be the default and therefore should be made optional.  However because because it is late in the cycle and there are other bugs requesting the ability to pass additional properties to the resolver, we don't want define a new property on each task and therefore we should just directly read the property from the ant properties.

title: Constants should be moved in IPDEBuildContants
desc: The following constants should be moved in IPDEBuildConstants:    IBuildPropertiesConstants 	public static final String PROPERTY_RESOLVER_MODE = "osgi.resolverMode";  	public static final String VALUE_DEVELOPMENT = "development";

title: Features not discovered from platform.xml
desc: related to  https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=183924 in 183924 plugins were listed though platform.xml  but not features. This is to add support for locating features through platform.xml

title: Enable auto format and import on save
desc: We need to enable auto format and import on save.

title: Plug-ins added multiple times to the state
desc: 3.3. RC2  When PDE Build is pointed at a baseLocation that contains a platform.xml, plug-ins from the baseLocation will be added twice to the state. Once because we are getting them from the platform.xml, a second time because we are blindly adding the content of the baseLocation.  This double addition results in numerous messages in the build output making the cause of build configuration errors hard to find.

title: Error message on failure of retrieve.xml could be more detailed
desc: 3.3 RC3 Since we fixed bug #174194, we have a more detailed message about where the error comes from when something failed during retrieve.xml. However the final message is still pretty raw "Could not retrieve feature.xml or build.properties." It could be improved to contain the name of the feature that had problems.

title: Missing working directory result in NPE
desc: 3.3 RC2 When the working directory has not been created the package script generator will fail with an NPE.

title: Signing zip files with jarprocessor ant task results in fake commands
desc: I'm not sure if this is the right place for this bugzilla. It is a combination of the AntBasedProcessorExecutor found in PDE and the JarProcessorExecutor in update.  The symptom is that when using the jarprocessor ant-task with sign="true" it makes attempts to execute a command called "fake".  I did some debugging and from what I can see, the method AntBasedProcessorExecuter.addSignStep() is never called. It can only be called from one place and that is in JarBasedProcessorExecutor.runJarProcessor() when the input is not a zip file.  Here is the stacktrace at the point of failure:  Processing c:\b32_0530\org.eclipse.buckminster\jnlp.ls\jnlp-package.zip Extracting jnlp-bootstrap.jar Running Sign on c:\b32_0530\org.eclipse.buckminster\jnlp.ls\temp_jnlp-package.zip\jnlp-bootstrap.jar Error executing command fake C:\b32_0530\org.eclipse.buckminster\jnlp.ls\temp_jnlp-package.zip\temp.jnlp-bootstrap.jar\jnlp-bootstrap.jar java.io.IOException: CreateProcess: fake C:\b32_0530\org.eclipse.buckminster\jnlp.ls\temp_jnlp-package.zip\temp.jnlp-bootstrap.jar\jnlp-bootstrap.jar error=2   at java.lang.ProcessImpl.create(Native Method)   at java.lang.ProcessImpl.<init>(ProcessImpl.java:81)   at java.lang.ProcessImpl.start(ProcessImpl.java:30)   at java.lang.ProcessBuilder.start(ProcessBuilder.java:451)   at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:591)   at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:464)   at org.eclipse.update.internal.jarprocessor.CommandStep.execute(CommandStep.java:42)   at org.eclipse.update.internal.jarprocessor.SignCommandStep.postProcess(SignCommandStep.java:56)   at org.eclipse.update.internal.jarprocessor.JarProcessor.postProcess(JarProcessor.java:248)   at org.eclipse.update.internal.jarprocessor.JarProcessor.processJar(JarProcessor.java:328)   at org.eclipse.update.internal.jarprocessor.ZipProcessor.processZip(ZipProcessor.java:138)   at org.eclipse.update.internal.jarprocessor.JarProcessorExecutor.runJarProcessor(JarProcessorExecutor.java:31)   at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.jarprocessor.JarProcessorTask.execute(JarProcessorTask.java:93)   ...

title: [PDE Build] Generate source fails when feature has license field without data
desc: Found in PDE Build 3.3 RC3.  This is a regression from 3.2.  When a feature.xml contains a license field with just a URL and no content, such as:    <license url="http://my.company.com/my/license.html"/> then PDE Build fails with a NullPointerException when generating a source feature for the given feature.  Here is the top of the stack trace (all of the PDE Build methods) that results:  Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.XMLWriter.getEscaped(XMLWriter.java:94) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.XMLWriter.printlnEscaped(XMLWriter.java:120) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.FeatureWriter.printLicense(FeatureWriter.java:108) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.FeatureWriter.printFeature(FeatureWriter.java:40) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.writeSourceFeature(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:1878) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generate(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:269) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generateEmbeddedSource(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:190) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.computeElements(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:138) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generateChildrenScripts(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:870) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generate(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:266) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BuildScriptGenerator.generateFeatures(BuildScriptGenerator.java:213) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BuildScriptGenerator.generate(BuildScriptGenerator.java:105) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.tasks.BuildScriptGeneratorTask.run(BuildScriptGeneratorTask.java:94) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.tasks.BuildScriptGeneratorTask.execute(BuildScriptGeneratorTask.java:81)

title: [doc] eclipsec.exe missing in packaging.properties
desc: The new eclipsec.exe is missing in the packaging.properties file. It should be     root.win32.win32.x86=eclipse.exe,eclipsec.exe  in plugin org.eclipse.pde.build/templates/packager/packaging.properties

title: Product Export on Mac always generates an "eclipse.app" additional to the branded "myproductname.app"
desc: Build ID: I20070601-1539  Steps To Reproduce: 1. Export a product with the delta pack on win32 for the mac  More information: 3.3 RC3  This is a major RCP bug since a product release for our customers may not contain any useless app bundles, that would only lead to unnecessary support requests.

title: forceContextQualifier can't be unset
Enable headless build from workspace
desc: It would be great if PDE Build could run headless builds from a single directory that contains a mix of features and plugins (i.e. a workspace) instead of from plugins/ and features/ or from an explicit pluginPaths listing.

title: RCP application headless build script does not build native launchers properly
desc: Build ID:  I20070625-1500  Steps To Reproduce: 1. Use the provided attachement to build a fully branded Windows RCP application. You will need to add:   - the Eclipse Platform for win32   - the RCP delta pack   - lib/rt.jar which I obviously didn't put in my attachement.  2. Observe that the resulting built has a launcher named "launcher.exe" instead of "product.exe", and the none of the provided icons  I could be missing something, but I am really running out of ideas here...  More information:

title: wrong forbidden access warnings for non-osgi plug-ins
desc: http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/I20070710-1416/testResults.php#PluginsErrors lists Forbidden Access Warnings for some org.eclipse.swt.examples.* plug-ins, e.g. org.eclipse.swt.examples.controls:  /src/org/eclipse/swt/examples/controls/ControlView.java : 5 warnings : FORBIDDEN ACCESS WARNINGS 1. WARNING in /src/org/eclipse/swt/examples/controls/ControlView.java  (at line 27) ControlExample instance = null; Access restriction: The type ControlExample is not accessible due to restriction on classpath entry /builds/I200707101416/src/plugins/org.eclipse.swt.examples/swtexamples.jar.   Since these warnings don't show up when I check out the projects from CVS, they also shouldn't be reported in PDE builds. The reason for the warnings may be that these example plug-ins don't have an osgi-style MANIFEST.MF.

title: Unpacked fragments have their manifest entries reordered during feature export
desc: I configured the "org.eclipse.rcp" feature as a dependency of my own feature, then used the Export Deployable Features wizard with the "Package as individual JAR archives" option.  As part of this process, the fragment "org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.win32.win32.x86_1.0.0.v20070523.jar" is exported to the plugins directory.  This fragment exists as an unpacked directory in my Eclipse IDE install directory, and this directory includes a META-INF/ECLIPSE.SF jar signature file.  Therefore, the new jar is interpreted as a signed jar.  So far so good.  The problem is that the contents of the META-INF/MANIFEST.MF file are somehow reordered, so that the hash of the manifest main attributes is no longer valid.  This renders the jar unusable for update sites and web start, since it has an invalid signature.

title: Infinite Loop in IdReplaceTask if version comes before id
desc: If in a feature.xml, the version comes before the id in an included plugin: <plugin version="3.3.0.qualifier" id="org.eclipse.foo" />  Then IdReplaceTask can enter an infinite loop when trying to replace the .qualifiers since it assumes the id comes first.   When writing source features, the arguments come out of a hash map and on some vms the version gets written first causing the infinite loop.  A partial fix is to use an ordered when writing source features, however, the IdReplaceTask still needs to be modified to handle this case.

title: buildUpdateJar target calls non-existing rootFiles*_*_* target
desc: Hi,  the generated buildUpdateJar target of a feature build.xml refers to a rootFiles*_*_* target which isn't existing in the build.xml. However there exists a rootFilesgroup_group_group target which calls the platform specific rootFile targets. The attached patch fixes this problem, though I m not sure it is a good solution.  This problem prevents people from using the buildUpdateJars target, hence set to critical.

title: [Doc] customBuildCallbacks: property <compilation target>.classpath not availlable
desc: Build ID: I20070621-1340  I need to static weave my model classes via toplink. Therefore I created a customBuildCallbacks.xml and  enhanced the target post.compile.<compilation target> where my compilation target is 'model.jar'. for the toplink-weaving task i need access to the same classpath the plugin classes have.  the documentation of the template as well as the eclipse-doc mention a provided property '<compilation target>.classpath' for this case. but surprisingly the property 'model.jar.classpath' is not defined. you can check this by an echo-task:  <target name="post.compile.model.jar">    <echo file="c:\temp\log.txt" message="${model.jar.classpath}" /> </target>  the content of 'c:\temp\log.txt' results in: ${model.jar.classpath}

title: Unused imports in PDE build tests in N20070831-0010
desc: 1. WARNING in /src/org/eclipse/pde/build/internal/tests/FetchTests.java  (at line 12) import java.net.URL; The import java.net.URL is never used 2. WARNING in /src/org/eclipse/pde/build/internal/tests/FetchTests.java  (at line 17) import org.eclipse.core.runtime.*; The import org.eclipse.core.runtime is never used

title: Problems with qualifier substitution and bundle look-up
desc: build i0904  When looking up a qualifier version in the PDEState, PDE/Build is returning a version (micro >= the requested version) which results in the wrong version being selected if there is more than one bundle with the same major/minor.  For instance, if you have bundles 3.6.0.foo and 3.6.1.foo and in the feature we have plug-in inclusions of 3.6.0.qualifier and 3.6.1.qualifier. When we do the look-up we are getting the same 3.6.1.foo bundle for both bundle look-ups.  Also we need to review this code because we return the first bundle which satisfies the constraints, rather than gathering all the results and returning the greatest version.

title: Refactor PDE.Build (Merge Provisioning branch)
desc: Created attachment 78869 [details] patch to pde.build and pde.build.tests  Looking forward to supporting the new provisioning work and to moving off of a dependency on update.core, PDE.Build has been undergoing a refactoring in the PROVISIONING branch.  Starting in M3 we should merge some of these changes back into HEAD.  The following changes will be made: 1) Remove dependency on update.core for the Site and Feature models.  In the future, pde.build will likely move to depend on org.eclipse.equinox.prov.metadata.generator (or equivalent), in the meantime, some classes have been cloned in org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.site.compatibility. (These changes still include a dependency on update.core for the JarProcessor, which will be moving to org.eclipse.equinox.p2.jarprocessor).  2) Refactor FeatureBuildScriptGenerator. (a) Move Source feature/plugin generation into its own class: SourceGenerator.  This will make it easier to address things like bug 148782, bug 130127, bug 197188  (b) Move "build orchestration" out of FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.  Have FeatureBuildScriptGenerator only responsible for generating the build script for a feature.  All other build orchestration type activities are moved into a new class BuildDirector.  This is the first step in decoupling the build from features, allowing the build to be driven from other artifacts like an IU from provisioning.  This should also make it easier to do things like feature dependencies and incremental build.

title: NPE in IdReplaceTask
desc: When building (or exporting) a feature that includes platform specific plugins for configurations that are not currently being built, there is an NPE that causes the build to fail.  The problem comes trying to replace the "0.0.0" with the real plug-in version, and no plug-in version is available since it isn't being built.  Expected behaviour is to leave the "0.0.0".  This was introduced by the fix for the infinite loop in bug 198536

title: os390 fragment version numbers different in rcp vs. executable feature
desc: In the org.eclipse.rcp feature, the version number of org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.gtk.linux.s390[x] is listed as 0.0.0.  In the org.eclipse.executable feature, the version number is 1.0.0. They should be the same.  From feature.xml of org.eclipse.rcp (output of build):      <plugin          id="org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.gtk.linux.s390"          os="linux"          ws="gtk"          arch="s390"          download-size="0"          install-size="0"          version="0.0.0"          fragment="true"          unpack="true"/>           	<plugin          id="org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.gtk.linux.s390x"          os="linux"          ws="gtk"          arch="s390x"          download-size="0"          install-size="0"          version="0.0.0"          fragment="true"          unpack="true"/>  From feature.xml of org.eclipse.executable:     <plugin          id="org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.gtk.linux.s390"          os="linux"          ws="gtk"          arch="s390"          download-size="0"          install-size="0"          version="1.0.0"          fragment="true"/>     <plugin          id="org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.gtk.linux.s390x"          os="linux"          ws="gtk"          arch="s390x"          download-size="0"          install-size="0"          version="1.0.0"          fragment="true"/>

title: Problem parsing generated features using update site optimizer
desc: Created attachment 80597 [details] stack trace from site optimizer, feature.xmls from org.eclipse.jdt.source from 3.4M2 and I20071016-1215  Ever since switching to the new pde build (latest version from Andrew), I've had a problem generating the update site digest.  Here are the parameters I use   <java jar="${eclipse.home}/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.jar"         fork="true"        jvm="${java15-home}/bin/java"        failonerror="true"        maxmemory="768m"        error="${buildDirectory}/errorlogupdatesite.txt"        dir="${buildDirectory}">        <arg line="-application org.eclipse.update.core.siteOptimizer"/>        <arg line="-digestBuilder -digestOutputDir=${updateSite} -siteXML=${updateSite}/site.xml"/>                </java>  I'll attach the stack trace that results.  The optimizer works fine against an old update site.  The reason that I'm opening this bug against pde build is that I notice that the generated features look different than than they used to with the old pde build.  The update site optimizer fails when parsing the org.eclipse.jdt.source feature.  I notice that the org.eclipse.jdt.source has a slightly different format than it used to - this may be why the optimizer exiting abnormally.  I'll attach some org.eclipse.jdt.source feature.xmls to show the differences.

title: Remove empty org.eclipse.pde.build.product.feature project
pluginPath not supported in "eclipse.fetch" task
desc: Build ID: M20070921-1145  I use PDE build to build an Eclipse product. My product's components come from 3 places: - Sources from a CVS repository - The Eclipse platform, located in ${baseLocation} - CDT features/plugins located someplace else  I have put the path to CDT in the variable "pluginPath" of my build.properties. The problem is, the "eclipse.fetch" task doesn't take this path into account and keeps telling me it cannot find CDT. It would be great if "eclipse.fetch" could use the "pluginPath" variable.

title: Headless PDE build produces .tar.gz which are .zip files for macosx.carbon.*
desc: Build ID: M20070921-1145  Steps To Reproduce: Just compile with PDE headless build scripts a product for macosx.carbon.*   More information: The problem is in ${eclipse.home}/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build_3.3.1.v20070828/scripts/productBuild/allElements.xml  The targets for macosx have .tar.gz files set as archiveNames. (All the others have .zip!)  Changing .tar.gz in .zip solves the issue.

title: Remove org.eclipse.pde.build.examples.rcp.cloud.releng from master
desc: Project points to CVS and seems outdated/ unused.  Last update was 4 years ago.

title: NPE in IdReplaceTask: backport to 3.3.1.1
desc: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #205230 +++  When building (or exporting) a feature that includes platform specific plugins for configurations that are not currently being built, there is an NPE that causes the build to fail.  The problem comes trying to replace the "0.0.0" with the real plug-in version, and no plug-in version is available since it isn't being built.  Expected behaviour is to leave the "0.0.0".  This was introduced by the fix for the infinite loop in bug 198536

title: NPE in eclipse.buildScript when building p2 bundles

title: Fragment versions not replaced in feature
desc: After build i1017.  When you look at the executable feature in the delta-pack, the version numbers for the fragments are all 0.0.0. Previously they had been replaced with real version numbers.

desc: Some small enhancements have been made to the feature generator.  These need to be documented. Currently this is the "includeLaunchers" option.  More enhancements may be made in 3.4
