title: NPE exporting a product
desc: Created attachment 123695 [details] one of the product files that cannot be exported  in i0122  I get the following NPE whenever I try to export a product from the UI. The product file is a little different in that it does not identify a product or application id but other than that it seems quite normal.    Marking this as a blocker we used to be able to use this workflow and it no longer works.  AFAICT there is no other way to get the product exported at this time...   !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2009-01-25 16:19:24.205 !MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Export Product". !STACK 0 java.lang.NullPointerException 	at org.eclipse.osgi.internal.resolver.StateImpl.getBundles(StateImpl.java:212) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.site.PDEState.getResolvedBundle(PDEState.java:492) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.ProductGenerator.createEclipseProductFile(ProductGenerator.java:323) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.ProductGenerator.generate(ProductGenerator.java:81) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generateRootFilesAndPermissions(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:390) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generateGatherBinPartsTarget(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:357) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generateBuildScript(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:153) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.generate(FeatureBuildScriptGenerator.java:125) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.BuildDirector.generate(BuildDirector.java:191) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.BuildDirector.generate(BuildDirector.java:175) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BuildScriptGenerator.generateFeatures(BuildScriptGenerator.java:224) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BuildScriptGenerator.generate(BuildScriptGenerator.java:109) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.exports.FeatureExportOperation.doExport(FeatureExportOperation.java:220) 	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.exports.ProductExportOperation.run(ProductExportOperation.java:69) 	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

title: Packager & Feature Generator missing BREE properties
desc: Build is set up to populate a State using whichever BREEs are defined in the build.  It appears that BREEs defined in a packager build are not making it all the way through in a packager build.

title: [repo] No repos defined by default in I20090126-0800
desc: WinXP, Build id: I20090126-0800  I decided to install this build the old fashioned way...delete old eclipse, download zip file and unzip it.  I started eclipse and when I go to "Install New Software..." or the repo preferences, there are no repos defined.

title: Unable to export deployable plugin if workspace is UNC
desc: Created attachment 123934 [details] Error log  Steps (using I20090127-0100 - 3.5M5 candidate):  - Install Eclipse into a regular directory  - Start it and select a workspace located on a UNC path  ( http://wiki.eclipse.org/Eclipse/UNC_Paths )  - Select a plugin from this workspace and choose "Export" -> "Deployable plugins and fragments" using regular directory as the export destination  - Error occurs:  Problem occured: 'Export Plug-ins' has encountered a problem. Buidlfile: \\mycomputer\share\workspace\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\temp\org.eclipse.pde.container.feature\build.xml does not exist

title: Packager's generated unzipper does not handle spaces in path
desc: Running the packager with a ${downloadDirectory} which contains spaces will result in problems when unzipping: [exec] unzip:  cannot find or open C:\Documents, C:\Documents.zip or C:\Documents.ZIP.  This is because the generated unzip code looks like: <exec executable="unzip" dir="${tempDirectory}/.">    <arg line="-o -X ${unzipArgs} "/>    <arg line="${downloadDirectory}/org.example.masterRoot-007-linux.gtk.x86.zip"/> </exec>  The nested <arg> specifying the zip should be specified with the "value" attribute instead of "line".

title: Support fetching Features from p2 repos
desc: The new p2IU fetch task supports fetching artifacts from p2 repositories.  However, in the case of features, the fetch script generator first tries to fetch just the feature.xml so that it can recurse and fetch nested features and plugins.  See FetchScriptGenerator#retrieveFeature and generateChildrenFetchScript  In the case of a p2repo, we can imagine just getting the metadata for the feature IU and using this to get the list of required children.  This will require the fetch script generator to have special knowledge of p2 and perhaps the p2IU fetch factory.  The alternative would be to have the p2IU factory download the feature jar and extract the feature.xml from it.  The worst case here is that the feature jar gets downloaded twice.

title: Branding p2 artifacts
desc: Because I didn't manage to convince the publisher to do it (bug 260066 comment #7), build needs to provide a task that can do the follow:  1) download artifacts containing the launchers for different configs 2) brand these artifacts with a new icon, rename exe, etc 3) republish the artifacts under a new product specific name  To make things a little easier, this will be tied to the artifacts generated by gathering feature root files (bug 249406).  This means that gathering org.eclipse.equinox.executables results in the source artifacts required for (1).  We can consider extending the Repo2Runnable task to do (1) for us, however because these are root file artifacts, we can only do one config at a time.  We could do multiple configs at once if we did the download ourselves.  If we reuse Repo2Runnable, it will need a few changes to make extending it easier.  (2) can be done simply by calling the existing brand task on the results of (1)

title: All tests failed in N20090209-2000
desc: Created attachment 125242 [details] pde build tests log log (core test)  I don' think that this is a releng issue but I'll open the bug here until I know what is happening.  All the tests failed with  Application "org.eclipse.test.coretestapplication" could not be found in the registry or java.lang.RuntimeException: Application "org.eclipse.test.uitestapplication"  could not be found in the registry  I'll attach the logs

title: Invoke the director to perform install during builds
desc: At the end of a product build using p2, we need to invoke the director to do a proper install.

title: Publish product or root IU at the end of the build
desc: Need to invoke the publisher to publish the final product or root IU for the build.

title: Plugin version doesn't take effect when exporting RCP product
Update archiving targets for p2 product builds
desc: Build currently creates archives by explicitly listing everything that goes in an archive.  When doing a director install for p2 product builds, we don't really know everything that is going to be in the result.  In this case we should just stick everything in the archive.  The ant zip target is currently doing this for p2 gathering (from bug 264603), but the other archive formats (antTar, tar, zip) need to do the same

title: Use new p2.process.artifacts  to sign when publishing
desc: When publishing from source, pde.build should use the new p2.process.artifacts for signing support.  See bug 265564

title: PDE Builder Throws NPE when dependent plugin manifest.mf missing bundle-version
desc: I'm using PDE's headless build scripts ('org.eclipse.pde.build_3.4.1.R34x_v20080805\scripts\build.xml').  In my build.properties, I specify several paths under pluginPath to a few hundred already built plugins.    Recently, one of those pre-built plugins was missing the Bundle-Version line in its manifest.mf.  PDE Builder failed with a NPE in the generateScript section:  generateScript:  BUILD FAILED C:\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.4.1.R34x_v20080805\scripts\build.xml:24: The following error occurred while executing this line: C:\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.4.1.R34x_v20080805\scripts\build.xml:64: The following error occurred while executing this line: c:\myStuff\customTargets.xml:12: The following error occurred while executing this line: C:\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.4.1.R34x_v20080805\templates\headless-build\allElements.xml:16: The following error occurred while executing this line: C:\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.4.1.R34x_v20080805\scripts\genericTargets.xml:88: java.lang.NullPointerException  I expect the builder to fail, however it provided no clue as to what was wrong.  I had to trial and error remove my dependent plugins until I found the single one that caused the break.  Then I had to study the manifest.mf until I tripped over the problem.  It took a few hours to resolve.   It would be nice to catch this NPE, and report which manifest.mf created the problem.

title: Accept context repos and pass them to publisher
desc: We need properties in which to specify context repositories to be passed on to the publisher during the build.  These are repos that we will reuse metadata from.  The major candidate here is the output from the repo2runnable task. Another is the profile from the running eclipse during an export.  See bug 259792

title: Generate default CU advice for products
desc: When building products for which the .product file does not specify start level information, build should generate default start level information in the same way it has always done for the config.ini/bundles.info.  This generation should take the form of p2.inf advice beside the .product file. See bug 265217

title: Consume start levels and properties from product file
desc: UI introduced start level information and config properties in the .product file.  Build will treat this as follows: Properties are merged with the ones build sets automatically Setting any start level information at all results in those levels being used and no defaults are generated.

title: Generated RCP Product breaks after first install of a feature
desc: Build ID: M20080911-1700  Steps To Reproduce: 1. We're generating an RCP product into P2 metadata. The Product contains our own feature and the org.eclipse.platform feature 2. We then use the p2 director to generate a product from the P2 metadata 3. After running the generated product, we install a separate feature using P2. 4. The config.ini is written over, with the osgi.bundles property getting set tot he new plugins, rather than retaining the reference to the simpleconfigurator plugin.    More information: I noticed the config.ini was marked as written by EquinoxFwConfigFileParser. When I placed breakpoints in that class and debugged the feature installation remotely, I see that during some touchpoint actions it reads and then saves the configuration. The problem is that it appears to be using some bad hardcoded values for LauncherData that refer to the eclipse launcher. We've changed the launcher name in our product to be "AptanaStudio".  If we specify a different osgi.configuration.area in our config.ini, then we don;t appear to experience this issue. Instead the product and another pre-installed feature are then locked for updates, making it impossible for users to get updates to our product.

title: Compiler warning in N20090305-2000
desc: 1. WARNING in /src/org/eclipse/pde/build/internal/tests/p2/PublishingTests.java  (at line 28) import org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder.*; The import org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.builder is never used

title: No Archive when publishing only source
desc: When publishing during the build, the archive is create during the packaging phase.  If there are no binary things included in the build, then the packaging archive call does not happen and we get to archive.

title: Build should passed transformedRepoLocation as a context repo
desc: Build has a transformedRepoLocation which is the results of a Repo2Runnable transformation.  This metadata should be passed to the publisher for reusing IUs instead of generating new metadata.

title: P2 Branding Task should remove repositories from manager
desc: The p2 branding task does not remove its repositories from the manager when it is finished. This can lead to problems while branding:  assemble.org.eclipse.pde.container.feature.p2.xml:80: The artifact is already available in the repository file:/C:/Dev/Platform/Workspaces/runtime-New_configuration/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/temp/assemblyLocation/buildRepo/.  There is something weird here as the artifact repo does not actually exist on disk at that location.   Note however, we should properly handle the branded artifacts already existing in the repo.

title: p2 product build fails when includeLaunchers = false
desc: Excluding the launchers from a product build causes it to fail on the branding step since there may be no launchers to brand

title: Allow appending existing product p2.inf
desc: PDE/Build will generate properties for a product p2.inf that will set defaults for launchers, start levels, etc.  Currently if a .product comes with a p2.inf file, then we don't do this.  This makes it hard to add some small property or touchpoint action to the product without having to specify all the default stuff build would generate for you.  We should allow appending to the p2.inf and have properties to control how much is generated.

title: Problem publishing source bundles with no source
desc: Publishing a source bundle fails if it contains no source.  For example, org.eclipse.rcp.source is a source bundle that is just branding for the source feature and it does not contain source.

title: Second state resolved due to premature site access
desc: AssembleScriptGenerator#shouldGroupConfigs accesses configScriptGenerator.getProductFile which causes a new site and state to be built and resolved because the configScriptGenerator has not yet been properly initialized.  This is a perfomance hit and can cause mismismatched version number and improper grouping and other problems.

title: Null launcher name in touchpoint action
desc: If the .product file does not specify a value for the launcher name, we can end up generating a executable CU that sets the launcher name to "null".  This results in a null.ini file, and we may also end up branding the launchers as "null"

title: p2 build leaves repo behind in preferences
desc: Running a build with p2.gathering=true will leave the buildRepo behind in the preferences.    If the buildRepo is deleted and a second build is run in the same instance  (perhaps an export, or running releng builds in the workspace), then the build will fail if the repo was not also removed from the available software sites preferences.

title: repoBaseLocation doesn't work
desc: At least for me.   The simple story is:  I moved up to R35_M6 base builder, and specified repoBaseLocation=<dir>/repos transformedRepoLocation=<dir>transforms in a build.properties file.   I then got the follow error message. Well, technically, I guess this is just an informative message, but it indicates the "wrong" customTargets.xml file, and things to downhill fast from there.    [build-xsl-xsl] processRepos: [build-xsl-xsl]    [subant] Invalid file: /home/shared/webtools/basebuilders/R35_M6/org.eclipse.releng.basebuilder/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5.0.v20090312-1500/scripts/home/shared/webtools/projectBuilders/xsl-R1.0-I/webtools.releng/releng.wtpbuilder/components/xsl/customTargets.xml   Notice the last half is the correct location of my customTargets.xml file,  /home/shared/webtools/projectBuilders/xsl-R1.0-I/webtools.releng/releng.wtpbuilder/components/xsl/customTargets.xml  Not sure why it's post-pending it to the location of pde build scripts.  Is that some side effect of <subant> ?   After looking at the code, I tried explicitly setting builder, builderDirectory, customTargets, and buildProperties, but to no avail.   Which reminds me, in my script I already had an ant variable named 'builder'. Not that I would do better, but you might try, when you add variables to PDE scripts, to give them unique names ... like eclipse.pde.builder, or something reasonably in your namespace. (I was pretty easily able to change my variable name, so no need to change it now ... at least for my sake).   I am doing a "feature build", if it matters.   Any ideas?

title: 36 tests fail in pde.build.tests after ant update
desc: Since the update to ant 1.10.1 (bug 499717), pde.build.tests has 36 fails n Windows. http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops4/I20170428-0830/testResults.php  The most tests fail with similar error:  \C:\shared_hudson\workspace\ep47I-unit-win32\workarea\I20170428-0830\eclipse-testing\test-eclipse\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.9.200.v20170326-1136\scripts\\build.xml is not an absolute path   I have a patch.

title: Report version numbers in feature/bundle not found errors
desc: After upgrading basebuilder to R35_M6 I've started to get the following error:  generateFeature:      [echo] Generating feature:     [echo]     [echo] featureId="org.eclipse.pde.build.container.feature"     [echo] buildDirectory="/home/michael/hudson/jobs/product-test.HEAD/workspace/build"     [echo] baseLocation="/home/michael/hudson/jobs/product-test.HEAD/workspace/build/eclipse"     [echo] productFile="/com.my.app/MyApp.product"     [echo] verify="true"     [echo] pluginPath=""     [echo] configInfo="linux,gtk,x86_64 & linux,gtk,x86 & win32,win32,x86 & macosx,carbon,ppc"     [echo] pluginList=""     [echo] featureList=""     [echo] includeLaunchers="true"     [echo] buildPropertiesFile=""  [antcall] Exiting /home/michael/hudson/cache/basebuilders/R35_M6/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5.0.v20090312-1500/scripts/productBuild/productBuild.xml. BUILD FAILED  /home/michael/hudson/jobs/product-test.HEAD/workspace/com.zend.php.releng/build.xml:117: The following error occurred while executing this line: /home/michael/hudson/jobs/product-test.HEAD/workspace/com.zend.php.releng/build.xml:151: The following error occurred while executing this line: /home/michael/hudson/cache/basebuilders/R35_M6/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5.0.v20090312-1500/scripts/productBuild/productBuild.xml:26: The following error occurred while executing this line: /home/michael/hudson/cache/basebuilders/R35_M6/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5.0.v20090312-1500/scripts/productBuild/productBuild.xml:71: Unable to find feature: org.eclipse.dltk.core.  org.eclipse.dltk.core is the first feature required by MyApp.product. This feature exists under ${baseLocation}

title: eclipse.brand fails on win32 packaging
desc: Build ID: N20090314-2000  Steps To Reproduce: 1. run headless product build with win32,win32.x86 config   More information: No problem exporting the product from the UI. Removing the icon  from the .product file successfully builds, no problem with other non-windows configurations.  I still have a .ico file with a 24x24 (8bit) image in it.

title: Generate Feature does not consider transformed Repos
desc: The eclipse.generateFeature task used in the product build is not passed the transformedRepoLocation and so fails to find bundles from that location.  Workaround would be to set the pluginPath to include the transformedRepoLocation

title: assemblyTempDir not deleted after assembly
desc: The temp directory is not getting deleted at the end of each platform specific assemble.  This can cause several problems: 1) as seen in bug 269322 with branding 2) If there are platform specific bundles being compiled, they can show up in the archives for other platforms. 3) Some archive formats (tar in particular) may end up being twice as large due to jars being included twice.  Workarounds vary, I would stay on M5 unless the new "p2.gathering" functionality is being used. If p2.gathering is being used, then this shouldn't be a problem and no changes are necessary.  If (2) is not a problem (because all platform specific bundles are binary and not built from source), then the simplest is to use a customTargets.xml and edit postAssemble. 	<target name="postAssemble">                 <!-- this is the default value of assemblyTempDir --> 		<delete dir="${buildDirectory}/tmp" /> 	</target>  If (2) is a problem, then the workaround depends on the specific allElements/customTargets.  This involves editing the defaultAssemble and  assemble.<feature>.<config> targets to include a delete  Product builds will need to copy pde.build/scripts/productBuild/allElements.xml, make the changes and set "allElementsFile" to point to the new file, this must be set before invoking productBuild.xml, which means on the command line, or in a wrapper shell or ant script.

title: no cocoa in PDE build.properties
desc: Wayne Beaton reported this to me via Twitter. Seems like it should be fixed.  "cocoa" isn't one of the platforms listed in the PDE build.properties file.

title: Don't produce and publish bits of bundles with compile errors
desc: Currently, the build proceeds if there are compile errors.  However, in the build we compare from a baseline and reuse existing bundles with the same tag to replicate the install a user updating from a repo will have.  Perhaps we should stop the build if there are compile errors to avoid problems with reusing bundles with the same tag that have compile errors.

title: [patch] Remove support for building 2.0-style pre-OSGI plug-ins
desc: Eclipse platform intends to remove the long-time deprecated "runtime.compatibility" bundles, see bug 394739.  In order for this to happen, PDE needs to finally remove support for building Eclipse 2.0-style pre-OSGI plug-ins   I see this as a natural progression from bug 407764 and bug 407765 :-)  I will submit a patch to "pde.build" to remove its dependency on "runtime.compatibility" and remove all the consequently dead code. Then I will submit a small patch to "pde.ui" for any modifications needed due to changes in "pde.build"

title: Fetch-Task fails when run from the IDE within the same JRE
desc: Build ID: M20090211-1700  Steps To Reproduce: I try to build a feature using PDE Build inside the IDE. Basically this is an ant launch configuration using org.eclipse.pde.build/scrips/build.xml together with some enivonment like -Dbuilder=....  During the fetch step, PDE Build retrieves the feature.xml file from the CVS. For this, a simple ant script retrieve.xml is being generated. My build fails as soon as the ant runner tries to run the retrieve.xml script. The error is: "Ant build {0} already in progress. Concurrent Ant builds are possible if you specify to build in a separate JRE." Unfortunately, this error is not visible (but this is perhaps fixed in bug 174194).  From the user perspective the ant build fails with "Could not retrieve feature.xml or build.properties for feature XYZ." The retrieve script is available and works fine. The fetch_XYZ.xml script is truncated (like in bug 144864 for example).  This issue is not normally a problem since these builds are usually performed headlessly. But I ran into it when I was trying to debug a problem with one of our builds.

title: Absolute root files not being published
desc: When using p2.gathering to publish features from source, we are missing any root files that were specified using absolute paths.  (On export of product from the UI without the deltapack, the executable is provided by UI using an absolute path).

title: Categories not mirrored into final destination repo
desc: When using the new p2.gathering to build repositories, generated categories are not getting mirrored out of the build private repo into the final destination.

title: Need option to not run director
desc: The product builds with p2.gathering=true automatically do a director install in the assembly/packaging phase.  We need an option to turn this off in case the user just wants a repository at the end.  We should also have an option to turn off mirroring at the end in case the user just wants the buildRepo.  I will use the same skip* as we already have (ie skipFetch, skipBase).  skipDirector skipMirroring

title: Plugins having multiple values for one filter attribute fail to get installed
desc: Build ID: M20090211-1700  Steps To Reproduce: 1. Create a plugin that has a platform filter for both macosx and win32 2. Build that plugin as part of a feature and generate a p2 repo 3. Install from the p2 repo, the plugin won't get installed.   More information: We have a XULRunner plugin to offer up a "Firefox-like" internal browser in Eclipse. It has a number of fragments and plugins that are platform/OS specific. On those plugins that have two values for any one of the attributes (say os being macosx or win32, or arch being x86 or x86_64), the plugins don't get installed. My best guess is because the metadata generated has an invalid filter syntax generated from this.  The generated filter is something like "(& (os=macosx,win32))". I would assume that an OSGi compliant filter would be "(| (os=macosx) (os=win32))".

title: Add support to log the director call
desc: Currently the output of the director call using when building products with p2.gathering = true goes to the console with the rest of the ant output.  We should add support for logging this to a file. This would make it easier for something like PDE/UI to extract the cause of a director failure instead of just reporting "java returned 13"

title: Mirror from context to buildRepo
desc: When reusing metadata from context repositories (bug 259792, bug 265863), the build may produce a repository that does not contain everything required to install a product (or feature).  This will occur in the particular case of root files associated with feature groups.  After finishing with out publishing of metadata, we should do a mirror: { buildRepo, contextRepo } -> buildRepo of the top level feature or product we are interested.  This mirror should do slicing to follow all dependencies.  This should transfer all required IUs in the context but not yet present in the buildRepo.  This should not cause the build to fail in the event of some missing requirements.

title: osgi.ws and other similar values are not correctly set
desc: I20090414 When I export an application from within the UI on the Mac, I notice that the installation does not contain the platform specific fragments.  This seems to be related to the fact that the values for osgi.ws, osgi.arch, etc are not properly set. For example here is what I find in my profile.   <property name='org.eclipse.equinox.p2.environments' value='osgi.ws="cocoa",osgi.os="macosx",osgi.arch="x86"'/>

title: Platform independent director install gets bad ws/os/arch
desc: When performing a director install for product builds, the call to the director is a forked exec of java.  On Windows, for a platform of "*,*,*", the windows shell is expanding the '*' based on the contents of the current directory, resulting in an effective command line like:  -p2.os assemble.org.eclipse.pde.build.container.feature.all.xml  build.properties buildRepo features <snip> -p2.ws assemble.org.eclipse.pde.build.container.feature.all.xml foo.product I.TestBuild log.log <snip> -p2.arch assemb... <snip>  Which results in a profile with <property name='org.eclipse.equinox.p2.environments' value='osgi.ws=assemble.org.eclipse.pde.build.container.feature.all.xml,        osgi.os=assemble.org.eclipse.pde.build.container.feature.all.xml,        osgi.arch=assemble.org.eclipse.pde.build.container.feature.all.xml'/>

title: root.folder properties are incorrectly collapsed on publishing
desc: PDE/Build supports root properties of the form root.folder.sub/path=file The result being that the file is placed under the "sub/path" folder in the resulting install.  Currently, when publishing features containing this kind of root property, the file is incorrectly placed in the root of the install.

title: Improved error message in PDE/Build - java.io.EOFException
desc: Build ID: M20090211-1700  Steps To Reproduce: Hi,  if you run a PDE headless build and the deltapack is not installed you receive a message similar to the following:   [java] BUILD FAILED [java] c:\eclipse-rcp3.5m6\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5.0.v2009 0312-1500\scripts\productBuild\productBuild.xml:32: The following error occurred while executing this line: [java] C:\eclipse-rcp3.5m6\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5.0.v2009 0312-1500\scripts\build.xml:115: The following error occurred while executing this line: [java] C:\eclipse-rcp3.5m6\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5.0.v2009 0312-1500\templates\headless-build\customTargets.xml:12: The following error occurred while executing this line: [java] C:\eclipse-rcp3.5m6\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5.0.v2009 0312-1500\scripts\productBuild\allElements.xml:10: The following error occurred while executing this line: [java] C:\eclipse-rcp3.5m6\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5.0.v2009 0312-1500\scripts\genericTargets.xml:182: The following error occurred while executing this line: [java] c:\temp\build\package.org.eclipse.pde.build.contai ner.feature.all.xml:23: The following error occurred while executing this line: [java] c:\temp\build\package.org.eclipse.pde.build.contai ner.feature.all.xml:15: The following error occurred while executing this line: [java] C:\eclipse-rcp3.5m6\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5.0.v2009 0312-1500\scripts\productBuild\allElements.xml:44: The following error occurred while executing this line: [java] c:\temp\build\package.org.eclipse.pde.build.contai ner.feature.win32.win32.x86.xml:96: java.io.EOFException   Would it be possible to catch this Exception and delivery a more readable error message?  Best regards, Lars    More information:

title: use pre-built binary source bundles when using generate.plugin in build.properties
desc: When running test builds for bug 266488 (switching to publisher), I discovered that the the ecf source bundles were being generated by the org.eclipse.equinox.p2.sdk because they are specified as generate.plugin as opposed to generate.feature in the build.properties.  This caused the build to fail.  When you specify generate.plugin in a build.properties, the prebuilt binary plugin should be used instead of generating a new source bundle.

title: executable feature.group depends on non-existant _root artifact
desc: The published org.eclipse.equinox.executable.feature.group has a dependency on the IU 'org.eclipse.equinox.executable_root', this IU requires a non-existant IU of the same name.  This is probably a problem with handling the root file properties, in particular the root.permissions property.

title: Need backwards compatibility for 3.4 bundles with custom build.xml
desc: Export is now switched over to use the publisher.  This is using a new target in the generated build.xml called publish.bin.parts.  This target obviously does not exist in older bundles.  Export with metadata will fail for older targets containing bundles with custom build.xml script.  Notably this is org.eclipse.swt and org.eclipse.equinox.executable.  The assemble p2 script will need a compatibility task to support these bundles.  Generally, this is calling the old gather.bin.parts target then running the publisher on the results.  (This is what was done for swt's 3.5 custom build.xml).  org.eclipse.equinox.executable may require special handling as its use in published products depends on the proper set up of its root properties which may have been missing in 3.4.

title: Nested jars are missing from published bundles
desc: Nested jars are missing from published bundles.

title: Ensure PDE export works OK for a plugin project with Java12
desc: With https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=544038 fixed, we need to add execution ID ( for Java 12) in PDE state for PDE export to work.

title: Reusing classfiles creates nested folders instead of jars
desc: When exporting with metadata (publishing) bundles that have nested jars, and reusing workspace class files is turned on, then these workspace class files are being placed in a subfolder instead of a nested jar.  eg:  org.eclipse.pde.build/pdebuild.jar/org/eclipse/* instead of  org.eclipse.pde.build/pdebuild.jar

title: Links for mac need branding
desc: The SDK ships the mac with a link in the root eclipse -> Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/eclipse  Using the publisher, to get this we will need the org.eclipse.equinox.executable feature to define root properties root.macosx.carbon.ppc.link=Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/eclipse,eclipse  This will also require the branding code to modify the link action on the corresponding root IUs  since the executable name will be changed.

title: Unable to export simple mail (feature based) when simple configurator is in your workspace
desc: If you try to export the a feature based product (simple mail) with the simple configurator in your workspace, it fails:  Unable to find plug-in: org.eclipse.equinox.simpleconfigurator_1.0.100.v20090413-2207. Please check the error log for more details.  I don't know if this is a publisher bug or a PDE build one.

title: Bad jar published for bundles without Manifests
desc: This comes from an interaction between pde.build and the publisher.  Given a plugin with and old-style plugin.xml and no manifest, we end up getting the wrong location for the bundle and we publish the first file in the project as if it was the jar.  There are problems in two places, fixing either one makes this better.  1) pde.build, GatherBundleAction#getBundleDescriptions.  We override the publisher action to load the manifest and we associate it with the first element of the File[] that is passed in.  We would be more robust to remember the bundle location for ourselves and ignore the passed in File [].  2) publisher, BundlesAction#expandLocations stops recursing when it hits a bundle, but it doesn't handle old-style bundles without manifests, we end up recursing and adding all the plugin's files are locations.  (2) confuses (1), and we end up publishing a regular file as if it were a jar.   I will fix the publisher to stop recursing if there is a plugin.xml or a fragment.xml.  I will also fix build to save the bundle location for itself.

title: Feature.xmls don't have their versions replaced
desc: When building with the publisher, feature.xmls don't get their version replaced.  When gather the feature we are taking the original feature.xml instead of the one that had the version replacements done.  This is causing PDE/Build test failures in N20090424-2000 since releng switched to the publisher

title: Category attribute on generator calls
desc: bug 272362 added category attributes for publisher calls.  The change was too widespread and added attributes for the generator calls as well.  The generator does not support this attribute, and fails.  This is causing test failures.

title: Permissions generated for files that don't exist
desc: When publishing features, there will be chmod actions generated according to the root.permissions properties.  The chmod action can fail if the file doesn't exist.  Generally, PDE/Build checks that the file exists by selecting the files to chmod out of the set that are being included in the archive.  However, when doing this selection, if absolute: root properties targeted at a folder are used, we can incorrectly include chmods that don't exist. eg: root.permissions.755 = eclipse root.macosx.cocoa.x86.folder.Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS=absolute:file:/foo/bar/Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/eclipse  The second property places the /foo/bar/Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/eclipse file under the directory Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS.  It is this eclipse file that is being incorrectly selected as a match for the permissions property.   This also has the affect of incorrectly excluding a permission that would have been correct root.macosx.cocoa.x86.permissions.755=Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/eclipse

title: [13] Export of plugin as Deployable plugin/Fragment fails with Java 13
desc: 1) Take Y build Build id: Y20190627-0200 2) Create a Hello World plugin project 3) Export as Deployable plugin/Fragment  Result : It fails  Expectation : export should be successfull

title: [publisher] Exported product missing eclipse.ini
desc: Using I20090428-0100 on Mac OS X.  After exporting a product with VM and program arguments, there is no eclipse.ini file located in eclipse/Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/ directory as expected.  The args do not appear to land in any other files contained in the exported product.  I have not had a chance to verify this on Windows or when exporting a product for multiple platforms, but will report back here when I do.

title: tag projects changed since I20090421-0930 build - pde build
desc: please retag org.eclipse.pde.build for I20090429-1800 because of bug 274181

title: Problems exporting cocoa.x86_64
desc: There are places in the code that say something like this:  String frag = EQUINOX_LAUNCHER + '.' + config.getWs() + '.' + config.getOs(); if (config.getOs().compareToIgnoreCase("macosx") != 0) //$NON-NLS-1$     fragmentName += '.' + config.getArch();  This was because on the mac, ppc and x86 are together in one fragment.  However, x86_64 is its own fragment.  Depending on how we are exporting, we could get a 32bit fragment, or exporting with metadata could fail.  Need to check PDE/UI and the publisher to see if there are any cases there.

title: Stop generating tasks for motif distributions
desc: Eclipse is not supporting Motif for years, it's time to stop polluting PDE build scripts with useless tasks.

title: Over aggressive Slicing in "assemble" feature export script
desc: We're currently using a "strict" slicing option. We probably don't want to do this because it prevents the use of ranges when creating IU Fragments in p2.inf.  For example: -- requires.0.namespace=org.eclipse.equinox.p2.iu requires.0.name=testid0 requires.0.range=[1.2.3,1.3)    <---- requires.0.greedy=true  units.0.id=testid0 units.0.version=1.2.3 units.0.provides.0.name=testid0 units.0.provides.0.namespace=org.eclipse.equinox.p2.iu units.0.provides.0.version=1.2.3 --  Right now (m7) we have to use: requires.0.range=[1.2.3,1.2.3] to get the IU to export correctly

title: Javadoc errors in pde bundles
desc: There are java doc errors in PDE https://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops4/I20190312-1800/compilelogs/pde.doc.user.javadoc.txt

title: After exporting, a product with a start level of "default" won't start
desc: Copied from bug 273961  I'm not using a custom config.ini.  I'm using the default values for a new product file, so it's a plugin-based product.    One thing I should mention - this is a bundle line-up that does not include simpleconfigurator, so I'm looking at the osgi.bundles property in config.ini.  If I add simpleconfigurator (and prereqs) to my line-up, then bundles.list does get populated correctly and the product runs just fine.  To reproduce:  1. New workspace 2. Configured my target to point to only 3.5M7 equinox-sdk and delta-pack bundles.  3. New generic project containing new product file. 4. Leave Product and Application values unset. 5. On Dependencies tab, add org.eclipse.equinox.http bundle, Add Required Plug-ins,should have 5 in the list. 6. On Configuration tab, add http bundle.  Set auto-start to true (see **** below)  7. On Launching tab, add "-console" to Program Arguments, add "-Dosgi.noShutdown=true -Declipse.ignoreApp=true" to VM args.  Also used "Bug273961" as the launcher name. 8. Export product (I have "sync" and "generate metadata" turned off), resulting config.ini has "@0:start" values for http bundle.  *** I just reported bug 274889, which prevented me from changing the auto-start value via the editor.  Please update that bug if you can or can't reproduce this issue too.  If you do run into the same issue, just open the .product file as a text file and change the start level there.  I get the same results with an existing product file that has several bundles enabled for auto-start at default start level.  I will also attach my product file here for reference.  If you want me to post a quick screencast running thru the scenario on my computer, I'd be happy to do that.

title: [doc] Doc the fact that product should define their flavor
desc: We need to document the fact that people should set a flavor when they are exporting a product.

title: Version increment required for org.eclipse.pde.build.tests
desc: Increment version for pde.build.tests  https://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops4/I20190717-1800/buildlogs/reporeports/reports/versionChecks.html  relevant log org.eclipse.pde.build.tests	1.2.300.v20190516-0730	1.2.300.v20190713-0610

title: product qualifier substitution broken for p2.generate.metadata
desc: When using p2.generate.metadata, the qualifier substitution on .product files is broken.  The problem is we substitute the qualifier at the end just before publishing the final product metadata.  However, there are points during the build when we publish metadata for the rootfiles (particularly the eclipse.ini), and these require the correct version.  Currently the product.ini metadata gets .qualifier and the final product IU requires those same IUs using the full version.  This results in unsatisfiable metadata.   Qualifier substitution works properly for publisher based builds using p2.gathering=true.

title: p2.inf is not processed if customBuildCallbacks is defined
desc: Build ID: I20090515-1143  Steps To Reproduce: 1. Create a feature that does something with p2.inf 2. Define customBuildCallbacks=somefile.xml in your build.properties file 3. Export or build and notice that your p2.inf is ignored and seems to have no effect   More information: It looks like in the case of a feature export with customBuildCallbacks wired up, the build actually happens in a temporary sub-folder.  However, the p2.inf is not copied into this temp folder and essentially does not exist for the build processes happening there.  One workaround is to copy the p2.inf into that folder, or simply include it in 'bin.includes' in your build.properties as this will copy it over for you (but you will end up with p2.inf in your final feature JAR).

title: BrandingIron compares String to File
desc: In org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BrandingIron#buildMac(), there is a comparison made between a String and File. In the event that they are not equal, an important directory is deleted. This seems like unintended behaviour. I don't know the code well enough to supply a patch immediately, but will try to look at it later today.  File rootFolder = getCanonicalFile(new File(initialRoot)); if (!rootFolder.equals(target)) { 	rootFolder.delete(); 	if (rootFolder.exists()) { 		//if the rootFolder still exists, its because there were other files that need to be moved over 		moveContents(rootFolder, new File(target)); 	} }  "target" is defined as a String earlier in the method.

title: Build.properties: Binary Build section does not handle '.'
desc: With the switch to running from JARs, Binary Build page does not allow  adding '.' to the list of bin includes - this must be done from source.

title: product qualifier substitution broken for p2.generate.metadata
desc: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #277514 +++  When using p2.generate.metadata, the qualifier substitution on .product files is broken.  The problem is we substitute the qualifier at the end just before publishing the final product metadata.  However, there are points during the build when we publish metadata for the rootfiles (particularly the eclipse.ini), and these require the correct version.  Currently the product.ini metadata gets .qualifier and the final product IU requires those same IUs using the full version.  This results in unsatisfiable metadata.   Qualifier substitution works properly for publisher based builds using p2.gathering=true.

title: RCP Product Export wizard copies over wrong Mac icon to launcher
desc: Build ID:  I20090611-1540  Steps To Reproduce: I have an RCP Product Export configuration containing the following:     <launcher name="ReCourse">       <linux icon="/org.tencompetence.ldauthor/branding/linux/ldauthor.xpm"/>       <macosx icon="/org.tencompetence.ldauthor/branding/mac/ldauthor.icns"/>       <solaris/>       <win useIco="true">          <ico path="/org.tencompetence.ldauthor/branding/windows/ldauthor.ico"/>          <bmp/>       </win>    </launcher>  I launch the Product Export wizard and select "Export for multiple platforms" and then select linux (gtk/86), macosx (carbon/x86) and win32 (win32/x86).  I look in the exported folder for Mac and see in the ReCourse.app/Contents/Resources folder that the wrong icon has been copied:  ldauthor.xpm     <---- This is the linux icon!  When it should be:  ldauthor.icns    <----- Mac icon!  It's copied over the icon from the Linux configuration and also added the incorrect entry to the Info.plist file!  However, if I run the export wizard without choosing "Export for multiple platforms" it's OK.  This broke in 3.5      More information:

title: OSGI Bundle Build failure only when exporting for deployment
desc: Build ID: 0211-1700  Steps To Reproduce: 1. Create a simple OSGI project named Bundle D using PDE with the following packages:  Bundle D |________ import package A[1.0.0, 2.0.0) |________ import package X[2.0.0, 3.0.0) |________ import package B[2.0.0, 3.0.0)                 |_______ import package X[3.0.0, 4.0.0)  2. From Bundle D make use of any public interface in package X that is different between versions 3.0.0 and 2.0.0. **IMPORTANT** If you notice Bundle D uses X[2.0.0] and *not* X[3.0.0] which is used by package B.  3. Click on export and deploy as plugin  4. The export will fail with a logs.zip complaining that the build failed. The build essentially complains that its using package X[3.0.0] and not X[2.0.0].  More information: 1. Was instructed to file a bug against PDE/Build based on this newslist thread: http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/newsLists/news.eclipse.platform.pde/msg01844.html  2. Some version informations that might be useful: Plug-in Development Environment 3.4.1.R34x_v2008 org.eclipse.pde.build PDE 3.4.0.v20080603 org.eclispe.pde PDE Core 3.4.0.v20090202 org.eclispe.pde.core PDE Runtime 3.4.0.v20080723 org.eclipse.pde.runtime

title: Ensure PDE export works OK for a plugin project with Java14
desc: Ensure PDE export works OK for a plugin project with Java14

title: Executable bit is not set on exported launcher executable.
desc: Build ID: 20090619-0625  Steps To Reproduce: Export RCP product based on features with: +Destination is: Archive file - (important) +Generate metadata repository - (important) +Export for multiple platforms  More information: Host OS: Windows Vista and Mac OS X 10.5.7 produce same results. Same export without 'Generate metadata repository' and/or ZIP Archive options, provide valid executable bit set on exported launcher.

title: Get rid of icu4j dependency
Context repositories not passed to the product publisher
desc: When publishing a .product file using <p2.publish.product> we aren't adding the context repositories.  This means, that if a product requires bundles for which start levels must be set, and those bundles are not already in the build repo then we will fail to create the start level IUs.  In these cases, such bundles are generally expected to be found in the context repositories, we need to pass those in.

title: customAssembly not set for assemble.p2 script
desc: The generated assemble scripts have an <available>  tasks to set the location of the customAssembly.xml.  When building with p2.gathering=true, the new assemble.<feature>.p2.xml scripts does not have the property set.  Workaround, is to set the property in the builder/build.properties file

title: Get rid of nested feature in pde.build.
desc: Its id is not referenced anywhere and last change of the version is from 2004. This makes me pretty sure it hasn't been of any use for long time (although I doubt it ever was).

title: [15] Ensure PDE export works OK for a plugin project with Java15
desc: Ensure PDE export works OK for a plugin project with Java15

title: customAssembly not set for assemble.p2 script
desc: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #283063 +++  The generated assemble scripts have an <available>  tasks to set the location of the customAssembly.xml.  When building with p2.gathering=true, the new assemble.<feature>.p2.xml scripts does not have the property set.  Workaround, is to set the property in the builder/build.properties file

title: product mirroring from context should be non-greedy
desc: Build performs a mirror or the product being built from context + build.repo into build.repo to ensure all requirements are present for the call to the director.  This is currently done with the slicer set to treat everything as greedy.  A feature based product will require the IU 'tooling.org.eclipse.update.feature.default' which has a requirement <required namespace='org.eclipse.equinox.p2.eclipse.type'            name='feature' range='0.0.0'           optional='true' multiple='true' greedy='false'/>  This will be satisfied by every feature present in the context repository, and will result in nearly the entire context repository being mirrored into the build repo.  This is potentially a huge performance problem.  Build should instead perform this mirroring without following non-greedy things.

title: product mirroring from context should be non-greedy
desc: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #283091 +++  Build performs a mirror or the product being built from context + build.repo into build.repo to ensure all requirements are present for the call to the director.  This is currently done with the slicer set to treat everything as greedy.  A feature based product will require the IU 'tooling.org.eclipse.update.feature.default' which has a requirement <required namespace='org.eclipse.equinox.p2.eclipse.type'            name='feature' range='0.0.0'           optional='true' multiple='true' greedy='false'/>  This will be satisfied by every feature present in the context repository, and will result in nearly the entire context repository being mirrored into the build repo.  This is potentially a huge performance problem.  Build should instead perform this mirroring without following non-greedy things.

title: Context repositories not passed to the product publisher
desc: +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #283060 +++  When publishing a .product file using <p2.publish.product> we aren't adding the context repositories.  This means, that if a product requires bundles for which start levels must be set, and those bundles are not already in the build repo then we will fail to create the start level IUs.  In these cases, such bundles are generally expected to be found in the context repositories, we need to pass those in.

title: Container features not published
desc: Container features that don't specify a bin.includes or contribute root files don't get published into the build repository.  If such a  feature is in the middle of the feature hierarchy of a product, then the product will not be installable.   When we are building for p2, we should publish these features.  We don't expect artifacts, but do want the feature.group IU.

title: NativeCodeSpecification resolution errors incorrectly reported
desc: If a bundle fails to resolve and the unsatisfied constraint is a NativeCodeSpecification, then we end up reporting a misleading error message:   Bundle org.eclipse.swt.carbon.macosx: 	Host plug-in Bundle-NativeCode_0.0.0 has not been found.

title: Typo filtering on NL in classpath generation
desc: ClasspathComputer3_0#matchFilter builds a dictionary to match filters against when adding bundles to the classpath.  It contains the following:  		if (arch != null) 			properties.put(OSGI_NL, arch);  Which is obviously a typo.  The likely result would be that bundles using a platform filter on osgi.nl would be filtered out of classpaths.

title: Bundle-NativeCode specs lost when replacing qualifiers
desc: During export, we get all resolved BundleDescriptions from the state that have versions ending with .qualifier and replace them with new ones with a proper version.  During this replacement, we don't copy the Bundle-NativeCode header over to the new BundleDescription.  I'm not sure what the consequences of this are, any bundles that failed to resolved because of a native selection-filter will not be considered.  Any bundles that did resolve, will continue to do so after the header is removed.  However, any place we consider filters, will not see the native filter.

title: PDE Build fails with NullPointerException if o.e.e.simpleconfigurator is missing
desc: Build ID:  I20090611-1540  Steps To Reproduce: Build an RCP application (headless) which includes the plugin org.eclipse.update.configurator but *not* the plugin org.eclipse.equinox.simpleconfigurator.  The build fails with a NullPointerException (see details). After adding org.eclipse.equinox.simpleconfigurator, too,  the build runs successfully.    More information: It seems as if older versions of org.eclipse.equinox.p2.metadata.generator contained the jar file org.eclipse.equinox.simpleconfigurator.jar while the version of o.e.e.p.m.generator does not contain the jar file anymore. It think it should either be added or the Generator should be updated not to search for the jar file and maybe write an appropriate error message.  Here is the stack trace from the log file: Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException    at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Activator.getURLConverter(Activator.java:313)    at org.eclipse.core.runtime.FileLocator.toFileURL(FileLocator.java:205)    at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.provisional.p2.metadata.generator.Generator.getBundleDescriptions(Generator.java:1177)    at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.provisional.p2.metadata.generator.Generator.generate(Generator.java:346)    at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.metadata.generator.EclipseGeneratorApplication.generate(EclipseGeneratorApplication.java:380)    at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.metadata.generator.EclipseGeneratorApplication.run(EclipseGeneratorApplication.java:364)    at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.provisional.p2.metadata.generator.IncrementalGenerator.run(IncrementalGenerator.java:43)    at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.p2.metadata.generator.ant.GeneratorTask.execute(GeneratorTask.java:40)

title: GET map file format does not properly unpack plugins
desc: In trying to switch to using JEM from HTTP GET map instead of from sources (bug 286159), I tried this in my map file:  plugin@org.eclipse.jem.tests,1.2.101=GET,http://archive.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/R3.0/R-3.0.5-20090521045405/updateSite/plugins/org.eclipse.jem.tests_1.2.101.v200904081630.jar,usetimestamp=true,unpack=true  But instead of getting a plugin folder in eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.jem.tests_1.2.101.v200904081630/, the jarred files were unpacked into eclipse/plugins/, and thus the plugin is not resolved.  I'm using Eclipse 3.5 & org.eclipse.releng.basebuilder from tag R35_RC4.

title: unpack="true" doesn't work for customBuildCallbacks
desc: With Eclipse 3.5 SDK  I have a feature.xml which among other contains this:     <plugin          id="org.mozilla.xulrunner.win32.win32.x86"          os="win32"          ws="win32"          arch="x86"          download-size="0"          install-size="0"          version="0.0.0"          fragment="true"          unpack="true"/>  So it's fragment and should be unpacked during install. Unfortunately it's not unpacked but remains jarred in plugins directory.

title: PDE customBuildCallbacks.xml template report wrong jar.location
desc: Build ID: I20090611-1540  More information: The PDE customBuildCallbacks.xml template under org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5....\templates\plugins reports a wrong property name in the comment for "post.name" target jar.location <- wrong jar.Location <- right with L uppercase

title: Export to Archive File doesn't work
desc: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; en-US; rv:1.9.1.2) Gecko/20090729 Firefox/3.5.2 Build Identifier: M20090211-1700  Eclipse Product export wizard offers a choice of outputting to a Directory (which works) or an Archive File (which doesn't).  I think I've seen this before, years ago, when I last tried it.  Reproducible: Always  Steps to Reproduce: 1. Click on Eclipse Product export wizard link in Overview tab in a .product file 2. Select the Archive file radio button 3. Fill in a file name 4. Press Finish 5. Wait for export to complete 6. Locate the new ZIP file in the Finder 7. Double-click to expand 8. Open the resulting folder 9. Double-click on the application icon (which will have a "NOT" overlay)  Result:  Finder responds with an error message saying it can't open the application ("wrong architecture").

title: p2.mirror grabs large portion of the repo
desc: I'm trying to build up a repo in small steps, so I started fresh with this mirror task:  		<p2.mirror destination="${transformedRepoLocation}-mirrored"> 			<source> 				<repository location="${eclipsep2Repo}" /> 			</source> 			<!--iu id="org.eclipse.sdk.feature.group"/--> 			<!--iu id="org.eclipse.equinox.p2.user.ui.feature.group"/--> 			<!--iu id="org.eclipse.emf.sdk.feature.group"/--> 			<!--iu id="org.eclipse.wst.xml_ui.feature.feature.group"/--> 			<!--iu id="org.eclipse.gef.feature.group"/--> 			<iu id="org.eclipse.rcp.configuration.feature.group"/> 		</p2.mirror>  where eclipsep2Repo=http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/3.6-I-builds  the generated mirror repo has content.jar,artifacts.jar, and a binary directory that looks to have the o.e.rcp.configuration_root artifacts (that's good).  It also has a plugins directory with 762 plugin in it ... not what I was looking for.  It also generated a message for every plugin it (shouldn't have) downloaded:  [p2.mirror] Artifact repository out of sync. Overwriting /shared/eclipse/e4/build/e4/downloads/drops/4.0.0/targets/helios-p2-mirrored/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.apt.core_3.3.300.v20090818-0240.jar [p2.mirror] Messages while mirroring artifact descriptors.

title: Enhanced error reporting from PDE build
desc: Example Scenario:  If plug-ins A and B are in the same feature, and plug-in A requires plug-in B, and plug-in B fails to compile, there will be cascading error messages about both plug-ins.  It would be helpful to emphasize the problems with plug-in B, since it's likely that fixing them will fix the problems in plug-in A, too.  Proposal:  Perhaps the simplest thing PDE could do is to keep track of which bundles have errors, and do a post-build dependency analysis to show that of the bundles that had errors which are lowest on the stack. This would have to be a custom task that used aggregated information from the build process.

title: Plug-ins not being built in dependency order
desc: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.0.14) Gecko/2009082707 Firefox/3.0.14 Build Identifier: org.eclipse.pde.build_3.4.1.R34x_v20081006  I'm invoking PDE/Build to build a feature which contains several plug-ins.  One plug-in (A), exports a package (which happens to have the same name as the plug-in).  The other plug-in (B), imports that package.  When I invoke PDE/Build on the feature, sometimes it builds plug-in B before plug-in A.  This causes the setup of the classpath to fail, which results in a cascade of errors.  I can't reproduce this problem reliably.  Sometimes it happens, and other times it doesn't.  I haven't been able to figure out what affects PDE/Build's behavior.  Reproducible: Sometimes  Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a feature that contains two plug-ins as described above. 2. 3.

title: A generated source feature misses some plugins
desc: I have a feature, org.eclipse.e4.languages.feature, that includes a few bundles that I'm picking up from my runnable repo.  My languages.source feature is generated by another sdk.source feature.  org.eclipse.wst.jsdt.core_1.1.0.v200909090450.jar and org.eclipse.wst.jsdt.core.source_1.1.0.v200909090450.jar are in the runnable, but the source feature is dropped from the generated source feature.xml   PW

title: Artifacts don't have MD5
desc: While trying to understand a problem with a bad update I looked at the artifact repository for 3.5.1 and realized that the artifacts do not have an associated MD5 signature. This means that if a download goes wrong but the connection closes properly the artifact would be properly written out without p2 noticing.  Could you explore the addition of MD5 to the artifacts?

title: Add support to pass error options to compiler
desc: JDT added support (bug 280784) to specify to report some warnings as errors instead.  We need to add properties to allow the user to take advantage of this.  The simplest is to just do the same as "javacWarnings.<library>" but call it "javacErrors.<library>"

title: [workspace] generated build script should use preference setting for source and target
desc: The values for "Source Compatibility" and "Generated .class files compatibility" (entered on pref page Window/Preferences/Plug-in Development/Build Options) should be used when creating a build script through PDE Tools/Create Ant Build File (from context menu of plugin.xml).  At the momement the script will contain  	<property name="javacSource" value="1.3"/> 	<property name="javacTarget" value="1.1"/>  No matter what the preferences are.  The build options should be the same whether I build within Eclipse or through an ANT script in my opinion.

title: p2 director app failed when export product with spaces in id
desc: 1. create rcp plug-in based on mail template 2. create eclipse product configuration 3. set the id of product with spaces, such as 'Mail RCP' 4. export the product 5. check option 'generate metadata repository'  Always got below error, E:\workspace\p2\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\temp\org.eclipse.pde.container.feature\package.org.eclipse.pde.container.feature.win32.win32.x86.xml:90: The following error occurred while executing this line: E:\workspace\p2\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\temp\org.eclipse.pde.container.feature\package.org.eclipse.pde.container.feature.win32.win32.x86.xml:495: The following error occurred while executing this line: E:\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5.0.v20090527-1800\scripts\genericTargets.xml:268: A Problem occured while running the director. The following error occurred while executing this line: E:\workspace\p2\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\temp\org.eclipse.pde.container.feature\package.org.eclipse.pde.container.feature.win32.win32.x86.xml:495: The following error occurred while executing this line: E:\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.pde.build_3.5.0.v20090527-1800\scripts\genericTargets.xml:268: A Problem occured while running the director.

title: Support requested to generate nested source feature
desc: Currently to generate the nested rcp source feature in  org.eclipse.platform.source, a hard-coded feature.xml which includes the  org.eclipse.rcp.source feature is required in the sourceTemplateFeature files  for org.eclipse.platform.  Would it be possible to remove the need for this  file if the build.properties for the generated source feature  (org.eclipse.platform.source) contains the directive to generate another  source feature,  ie. generate.feature@org.eclipse.rcp.source=org.eclipse.rcp?

title: Improve classpath computer to be more fidel to the runtime
desc: When pde build compiles java code, the compile path used is approximate (For example the whole plug-in gets added to the compile path). Now that jdt supports exclusion filter through the command line, pde build could use this feature to provide a classpath that is more fidel to what the runtime is doing.

title: Why the double call to generate?
desc: In org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BuildScriptGenerator there is a double call to generator.generate() in the generateModels(List models). Why the need for a double call within the loop? A small comment to explain would be nice.

title: Mechanism required to generate source features with jar'd plug-ins
desc: I would like to jar the org.eclipse.platform.doc isv plug-in which is part of the org.eclipse.platform.source feature.  I believe the only way for me to do this currently is to keep a hard-coded feature.xml in the sourceTemplateFeature in the org.eclipse.platform-feature with the attribute unpack="false".  This is a request for a mechanism that triggers the addition of unpack="false" for plugins listed in generated source feature.xml via the generate.feature property.  ie. maybe something like:  generate.feature@org.eclipse.platform.source=org.eclipse.platform, plugin@org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv;unpack="false"

title: [16] Ensure PDE export works OK for a plugin project with Java16
desc: Ensure PDE export works OK for a plugin project with Java16.

title: need support to set JRE level for each plugin
desc: We are going to add markup in each plugin to note the Required- ExecutionEnvironment (e.g., 1.4, 1.5, Foundation, ...).  This information can  be used to control the compiler settings and filter the classpath.  PDE Build needs to gather this info from the manifest.mf and perhaps some  source settings from build.properties and set the appropriate command line  args.

title: NPE during Export -> Product
desc: cloned for 3.5.2, this was introduced with the fix for bug 281372 that was released to 3.5.1  +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #292327 +++  While executing Export -> Product I get an NPE error partway through the Linux platform export.  In my .product file there are launcher icons supplied for Windows but not for Linux.  Removing all windows launcher icons from .product eliminated the NPE during export.   Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: name can't be null     at java.io.FilePermission.init(FilePermission.java:171)     at java.io.FilePermission.<init>(FilePermission.java:249)     at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkRead(SecurityManager.java:871)     at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.AntSecurityManager.checkRead(AntSecurityManager.java:284)     at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:100)     at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.Utils.copy(Utils.java:408)     at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BrandingIron.brandLinux(BrandingIron.java:106)     at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.BrandingIron.brand(BrandingIron.java:74)     at org.eclipse.pde.internal.build.tasks.BrandTask.execute(BrandTask.java:46)     ... 24 more

title: Unable to export on I20051011-1655 build
desc: Just upgraded to the I20051011-1655 build.  I can no longer export the  org.eclips.osgi project as a deployable plugin.  I get the following error:  C:\workspaces\test- IBuild\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.ui\temp\org.eclipse.pde.container.fea ture\build.xml:29: The following error occurred while executing this line: C:\workspaces\test- IBuild\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.ui\temp\org.eclipse.pde.container.fea ture\build.xml:10: The following error occurred while executing this line: C:\workspaces\test-IBuild\org.eclipse.osgi\build.xml:99: The following error  occurred while executing this line: C:\workspaces\test-IBuild\org.eclipse.osgi\build.xml:56: Reference  @dot.classpath not found.

title: Export of plugin sometimes fail with "Target level '1.2' is incompatible with source level '1.8'"
desc: I get this error sometimes  # 12/11/20, 11:23:53 am IST # Eclipse Compiler for Java(TM) v20201110-0745, 3.24.0, Copyright IBM Corp 2000, 2020. All rights reserved. Target level '1.2' is incompatible with source level '1.8'. A target level '1.8' or better is required  It is not always reproducible but I have seen it many times.  This default value comes from JDT. As a workaround, we can set javacTarget to 1.8 if less than 1.8

title: Investigate a scheme / computation that allows to generate meaningful qualifier for source plugins
desc: With the mechanism in place today, the qualifier for the source plug-ins and source features is always derived from the time stamp. This is fine in the early days of the development cycle, however as stability is being reached toward the end of a release, having a qualifier changing on every rebuild will be annoying if the source does not change. Moreover having such timestamp derived qualifier alter the reproduceability of builds.

title: Plugin export creates faulty bundle when using custom target platform and junit4 dependency
desc: User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9.1.3) Gecko/20090910 Ubuntu/9.04 (jaunty) Shiretoko/3.5.3 Build Identifier: 20090920-1017  When using a custom target platform containing the junit4 bundle, exporting a plugin causes said plugin to be faulty: Instead of a normal bundle, the resulting jar seems to be just the zipped up project directory (with .class files residing in bin/). The .java files are in src/, and there is a .settings file. Another thing is that the qualifier part in the bundle name is not replaced by a date string.  Since this is not a valid OSGi bundle, subsequent uses of the bundle fail. The export works just fine when using the "Running platform" as target platform.  I observed this issue only with junit4, but it may be applicable to other bundles as well.  A serious factor is that this corruption is silent, which is especially worrisome for automated builds.  Using eclipse-rcp-galileo-SR1-linux-gtk  Reproducible: Always  Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create new minimal plug-in project 2. Add require-bundle dependency on junit4 to above bundle 3. Export plugin -> resulting file is a "good" bundle "foo_1.0.0.200910211417.jar" 4. setup a minimal custom target platform containing only the junit4 bundle (extra directory + .target file) 5. Set the created target as active target platform 6. Export plugin -> resulting file is a broken bundle "foo_1.0.0.qualifier.jar" that exhibits above mentioned faulty directory structure  When using the attached test case, only steps 5 & 6 need to be executed.

title: unpack="true" doesn't work for customBuildCallbacks
desc: Consider for 3.5.2.  This happens with p2.gathering=true +++ This bug was initially created as a clone of Bug #287537 +++  With Eclipse 3.5 SDK  I have a feature.xml which among other contains this:     <plugin          id="org.mozilla.xulrunner.win32.win32.x86"          os="win32"          ws="win32"          arch="x86"          download-size="0"          install-size="0"          version="0.0.0"          fragment="true"          unpack="true"/>  So it's fragment and should be unpacked during install. Unfortunately it's not unpacked but remains jarred in plugins directory.

title: no suitable callback for bytecode enhancing in customBuildCallbacks
desc: This is related to bug #35371    Unfortunately, the callbacks provided do not include a callback like "postCompile" that is to be invoked between compilation and building of jars (i.e. before the comment <!-- Copy necessary resources --> in the .jar target).  Bytecode enhancing works on single individual class files not yet contained in a .jar, so it must occur between compilation and creation of the .jar.

title: Plugin not found during update site build
desc: This is a problem found by our customer when he tried to setup his internal  update site for his users. Here is the scenario of the problem 1. Download eclipse 3.1.1, PDE and JDT 3.1.1 2. Start this instance and create an update site project 3. Add JDT, PDE, platform and RCP to the update site project and build the  whole update site 4. Download eclipse 3.1.0, PDE and JDT 3.1.0 5. Start 3.1.0 instance and update it to 3.1.1 using the update site created in  step 3 and restart the eclipse 6. Create an update project in the upgraded eclipse and add the four features  to the update site 7. Build the update site and an error message about org.eclipse.pde.core 3.1.0  not found is issued  Why does it look for org.eclipse.pde.core_3.1.0 since it's already replaced by  org.eclipse.pde.core_3.1.1? The screen capture is attached.

title: Building with access rules causes many invalid warnings
desc: Recent support for access rules causes many invalid warnings when building in releng style mode. There are multiple causes: 1) incorrect handling of fragments 2) use of ${build.result.folder} in some of the classpaths 3) bug 119108

title: Clean up support for JRE compilation profiles
desc: As discussed, modify the pde.build support for execution environment as follows:  plugin/build.properties:  jre.compilation.profile="J2SE-1.4" A property to override the manifest's Bundle-RequiredExectionEnvironment.  This implies a values for the bootclasspath, javacSource and javacTarget if they are not already set.  Top level build.properties:  change bootclasspath.<EE> to simply <EE> ie: bootclasspath.J2SE-1.4 -> J2SE-1.4   PDE.UI will need to pass the top level <EE> properties supported.  The value for the <EE> property is expected to be the path to the jars for the bootclasspath ("C:\jre\lib\rt.jar;C:\jre\lib\jsse.jar").  The value of jre.compilation.profile is expected to be one of those properties.

title: Remove reference to internal p2 methods in BrandP2Task
desc: I20091020  BrandP2Task has references to some internal p2 methods that I would like to delete (Activator.getMetadataRepositoryManager and getArtifactRepositoryManager). There is no reason for PDE to use these methods, and in fact elsewhere in the same class it is already doing lookups of these services. I will attach a patch to avoid use of these methods.

title: [patch] Be a bit more verbose when fetching things with p2
desc: Created attachment 150700 [details] Patch to improve diagnosis information when fetching things via p2  I was having some fun with PDE Build yesterday and in order to more easily understand what's going on I modified the p2 fetch factory to be more verbose in what they are doing. This patch also aids in making the generated fetch script more readable.  Note, the patch was done against HEAD but I hope it still applies to the R3_6_api_cleanup branch.

title: Change product build to use in-process director
desc: bug 290207 introduces support to have multiple p2 agents in the same vm, we should take advantage of this for product builds.  This allows removing the forking of a new process to perform the director install

title: Wrong path passed to post.gather.source/logs
desc: The custom callbacks pre/post.gather.sources/logs have a parameter target.folder to which we are passing the value ${destination.temp.folder}.  However, the sources and logs are actually being copied to ${destination.temp.folder}/BundleName_version.  This should be changed since with .qualifier versions, the actual directory will be different each time.  This would stop people from being able to use the callbacks as a workaround for something like 119415

title: Generated calls to javac should include compiler attribute as build.compiler Ant property
desc: It has been recommended that the compiler attribute in compilerarg elements be included in generated build scripts, ie.  <javac ...>   <compilerarg line="${compilerArg}" compiler="${build.compiler}"/>  ...   <compilerarg value="@${basedir}/javaCompiler...args" compiler="${build.compiler}" />    </javac>  This in a effort to ensure compiler args don't cause failures when a non-supporting compiler is used.

title: generated version of the jdt source feature is not stable
desc: I20060117 In the build I20060117 the version of the jdt.source feature is:       org.eclipse.jdt.source_3.2.0.200601170810--SAA8P88GP  In thd build I20060118 the version of the jdt.source feature is:    org.eclipse.jdt.source_3.2.0.200601180815--SAA8P88GP  Whereas the content of the feature did not change.  In fact you can see that nothing changed since the generated segment is the same.  This is not too big of a deal since the plug-ins won't be re-downloaded, but it should eventually be fixed.

title: Enhancement Request: refactor customTargets.xml
desc: In the default case, the only customization required to run PDE Build for customTargets.xml is to add individual ant calls for each feature in the "allElements" target and subsequently add the corresponding "assemble" targets for each feature.  1) With each release of Eclipse (or at least each update to milestones)    one has to check if any changes/improvements went into the    customTargets.xml template and then copy over the changes into your copy. 2) Due to the content and structure of customTargets.xml one cannot easily    dynamically inject the list of features to build and assemble. i.e.    Typically you would go off and add a feature in the IDE and then go over    and modify the customTargets.xml and add (at least) two sections for that    feature.  Suggestion: refactor the customTargets.xml template into two templates: customTargets.xml and allElements.xml. Have customTargets.xml's 'allElements' delegate to allElements.xml's 'allElementsDelegator'. The 'allElementsDelegator' is basically a copy of the original 'allElements' target. Include all the assemble targets in allElements.xml. Then use <import file="${allElementsFile} /> to pull in all the targets from the allElements.xml into customTargets.xml.  Why? Now you only need to modify allElements.xml to add/remove features from the automated build, allowing isolation from possible changes to the customTargets.xml. But more importantly, you can generate allElements.xml based upon the features present in your features/ directory.  I have taken this approach and went one step further. When I generate my allElements.xml I identify all the features that have a specific property set in it's corresponding build.properties file to determine if the feature takes part in the headless build... i.e.) Headless-Build=<value>[,<value>] Simply creating a feature and setting this property would declare that it participates in a headless build (Providing a list of values permits filtering features for specific target types of headless builds)...  I'll attach the diff for customTargets.xml as well as allElements.xml for your perusal  Cheers,  John.

title: [17] Ensure PDE export works OK for a plugin project with Java17

title: NPE in Product Export
desc: If a product configuration is based on features rather than on plugins, an export must fail due to an implementation error in ProductFile.java:202    useFeatures = IBuildPropertiesConstants.TRUE.equals(use.toUpperCase());  can never evaluate to true, because IBuildPropertiesConstants.TRUE is lower case "true"!  I'd suggest to use standard    useFeatures = Boolean.parseBoolean(use);  instead...  Cheers /Eike

title: Consider rewriting P2IUFetchFactory
desc: The current implementation of fetching bundles from a p2 repository is a separate invocation of p2.repo2runnable for each bundle.  We would get better performance if we could do a single invocation with a list of IUs to get. Like: <p2.repo2runnable>    <iu id="bundle1" />    <iu id="bundle2" />    ... </p2.repo2runanble>  This would require making P2IUFetchFactory remember the IU on each call to  #generateRetrieveElementCall, and then later on #addTargets we generate the single p2.repo2runnable invocation.
